Exclusion of shares held by any person should not be construed to indicate that the person&#160;&#160;possesses the power, direct or indirect, to direct or cause the direction of the management or policies of the registrant, or that the person is controlled by or under common control with the registrant.

<TD VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="58%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="5%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	This Annual Report on Form&#160;10-K contains forward-looking statements relating to future events and our future performance within the meaning of Section&#160;27A of the Securities Act of 1933, as amended, and Section&#160;21E of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended. Stockholders are cautioned that such statements involve risks and uncertainties, including: The ability to complete the Biotie Therapies Corp. transaction on a timely basis or at all; the ability to realize the benefits anticipated from the Biotie Therapies transaction and the Civitas Therapeutics, Inc. transaction, among other reasons because acquired development programs are generally subject to all the risks inherent in the drug development process and our knowledge of the risks specifically relevant to acquired programs generally improves over time; the ability to successfully integrate Biotie Therapies&#8217; operations and Civitas's operations, respectively, into our operations; we may need to raise additional funds to finance our expanded operations and we may not be able to do so on acceptable terms; our ability to successfully market and sell Ampyra in the U.S.; third party payers (including governmental agencies) may not reimburse for the use of Ampyra or our other products at acceptable rates or at all and may impose restrictive prior authorization requirements that limit or block prescriptions; the risk of unfavorable results from future studies of Ampyra or from our other research and development programs, including CVT-301, Plumiaz, or any other acquired or in-licensed programs; we may not be able to complete development of, obtain regulatory approval for, or successfully market CVT-301, Plumiaz, or any other products under development, or the products that we would acquire if we complete the Biotie Therapies transaction; the occurrence of adverse safety events with our products; delays in obtaining or failure to obtain and maintain regulatory approval of or to successfully market Fampyra outside of the U.S. and our dependence on our collaborator Biogen&#160;in connection therewith; competition; failure to protect our intellectual property, to defend against the intellectual property claims of others or to obtain third party intellectual property licenses needed for the commercialization of our products; and failure to comply with regulatory requirements could result in adverse action by regulatory agencies. These forward-looking statements are based on current expectations, estimates, forecasts and projections about the industry and markets in which we operate and management's beliefs and assumptions. All statements, other than statements of historical facts, included in this report regarding our strategy, future operations, future financial position, future revenues, projected costs, prospects, plans and objectives of management are forward-looking statements. The words "anticipates," "believes," "estimates," "expects," "intends," "may," "plans," "projects," "will," "would," and similar expressions are intended to identify forward-looking statements, although not all forward-looking statements contain these identifying words. Actual results or events could differ materially from the plans, intentions and expectations disclosed in the forward-looking statements we make, and investors should not place undue reliance on these statements. In addition to the risks and uncertainties described above, we have included important factors in the cautionary statements included in this Annual Report, particularly in the "Risk Factors" section, that we believe could cause actual results or events to differ materially from the forward-looking statements that we make. Our forward-looking statements do not reflect the potential impact of any future acquisitions, mergers, dispositions, joint ventures or investments that we may make. Forward-looking statements in this report are made only as of the date hereof, and we do not assume any obligation to publicly update any forward-looking statements as a result of developments occurring after the date of this report.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;

<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	We and our subsidiaries own several registered trademarks in the U.S. and in other countries.&#160;&#160;These registered trademarks include, in the U.S., the marks &#8220;Acorda Therapeutics,&#8221; our stylized Acorda Therapeutics logo, &#8220;Ampyra,&#8221; &#8220;Zanaflex,&#8221; &#8220;Zanaflex Capsules,&#8221; &#8220;Qutenza&#8221; and &#8220;ARCUS.&#8221;&#160;&#160;Also, our mark &#8220;Fampyra&#8221; is a registered mark in the European Community Trademark Office and we have registrations or pending applications for this mark in other jurisdictions.&#160;&#160;Our trademark portfolio also includes several registered trademarks and pending trademark applications (e.g., &#8220;Plumiaz&#8221;) in the U.S. and worldwide for potential product names or for disease awareness activities.&#160;&#160;Third party trademarks, trade names, and service marks used in this report are the property of their respective owners.

<EFX_PART_I>
<A NAME="FIS_PART_I"></A>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<A NAME="REPORT_ANNUAL-123115_HTM_PARTI">
<!--EFPLACEHOLDER-->
</A>
	PART I
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<A NAME="REPORT_ANNUAL-123115_HTM_DC73301_ITEM_1__BUSINESS_">
<!--EFPLACEHOLDER-->
</A>
<A NAME="REPORT_ANNUAL-123115_HTM_TOC_DC73301_2">
<!--EFPLACEHOLDER-->
</A>
<A NAME="REPORT_ANNUAL-123115_HTM_ITEM1">
<!--EFPLACEHOLDER-->
</A>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<EFX_BUSINESS>
<A NAME="FIS_BUSINESS"></A>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Item 1.&#160;&#160;Business.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Company Overview
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	We are a biopharmaceutical company dedicated to the identification, development and commercialization of novel therapies that restore function and improve the lives of people with neurological disorders.&#160;&#160;We market three U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA)-approved therapies, including Ampyra (dalfampridine) Extended Release Tablets, 10mg, a treatment to improve walking in patients with multiple sclerosis, or MS, as demonstrated by an increase in walking speed.&#160;&#160;We also market Zanaflex Capsules and tablets, FDA-approved as short-acting drugs for the management of spasticity, and Qutenza, an FDA-approved dermal patch for the management of neuropathic pain associated with post-herpetic neuralgia, also known as post-shingles pain.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	We have five Orange Book-listed patents providing protection for Ampyra up to 2027.&#160;&#160;Ampyra also has Orphan Drug designation, which gives it marketing exclusivity in the U.S. until January 2017.&#160;&#160;Our Orange Book-listed patents for Ampyra are the subject of lawsuits relating to Paragraph IV Certification Notices received from several generic drug manufacturers, and also
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	inter partes
</FONT>
	review (IPR) petitions filed by a hedge fund with the U.S. Patent and Trademark Office.&#160;&#160;An adverse outcome in these legal proceedings could result in our loss of some or all Orange-Book listed patents that we rely on for Ampyra.&#160;&#160;These legal proceedings are described below under &#8220;Company Highlights &#8211; Ampyra/Fampyra Patents and Legal Proceedings&#8221; and in Part I, Item 3 of this report.&#160;&#160;We will vigorously defend our intellectual property rights.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	We have an industry leading pipeline of novel neurological therapies addressing a range of disorders, including MS, Parkinson&#8217;s disease, chronic post-stroke walking deficits (PSWD), epilepsy and migraine.&#160;&#160;Our goal is to help patients to a better future, while building a leading neurology company with a portfolio of innovative products.&#160;&#160;Our pipeline includes the following three late stage programs:
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE ALIGN="CENTER" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" ID="HANGINGINDENT" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="">
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT;">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 54PT">
<DIV>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE" FACE="SYMBOL, SERIF">
	&#183;
</FONT>
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	CVT-301, an inhaled formulation of levodopa, or L-dopa, using our proprietary ARCUS technology, in Phase 3 development for the treatment of OFF periods in Parkinson&#8217;s disease;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE ALIGN="CENTER" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" ID="HANGINGINDENT" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="">
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT;">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 54PT">
<DIV>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE" FACE="SYMBOL, SERIF">
	&#183;
</FONT>
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Plumiaz, a proprietary nasal spray formulation of diazepam, in Phase 3 development for the treatment of people with epilepsy currently on stable regimens of antiepileptic drugs (AEDs) who experience bouts of increased seizure activity, also known as seizure clusters or acute repetitive seizures; and
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE ALIGN="CENTER" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" ID="HANGINGINDENT" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="">
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT;">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 54PT">
<DIV>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE" FACE="SYMBOL, SERIF">
	&#183;
</FONT>
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	A program evaluating the use of twice-daily (BID) dalfampridine to improve walking in people who are suffering from chronic post-stroke walking deficits (PSWD), and exploring a once daily (QD) formulation of dalfampridine for use in this program.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	We are expecting important clinical milestones in 2016 for all three of these late-stage programs, including the completion of a pivotal trial for the CVT-301 program this year, and we plan to file New Drug Applications for both the CVT-301 and Plumiaz programs in 2017.&#160;&#160;We project that these two therapies, if approved, could generate combined peak annual U.S. net revenue of more than $700 million.&#160;&#160;Also, in 2016 we expect to perform an interim analysis in our Phase 3 trial of dalfampridine for chronic post-stroke walking deficits.&#160;&#160;This analysis, combined with results from our development efforts on a once-daily formulation of dalfampridine, will establish the next steps for the program.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	In January 2016, we announced that we had entered into an agreement to acquire Biotie Therapies Corp. for a cash purchase price of approximately $363 million.&#160;&#160;Subject to completion of the acquisition, which we
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<BR>
<DIV ID="PGBRK" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<DIV ID="FTR">
<DIV ID="GLFTR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="PN" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS; WIDTH: 100%">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; WIDTH: 100%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; WIDTH: 100%">
<HR STYLE="COLOR: BLACK" NOSHADE SIZE="2">
</DIV>
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage6"></A>
<DIV ID="HDR">
<DIV ID="GLHDR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<A HREF="#REPORT_ANNUAL-123115_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<BR>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
	expect to occur in the third quarter of 2016, we would acquire worldwide rights to tozadenant, an oral adenosine A2a receptor antagonist currently in Phase 3 development as an adjunctive treatment to levodopa in Parkinson&#8217;s disease patients to reduce OFF time.&#160;&#160;A2a receptor antagonists have the potential to be the first new class of drug for Parkinson&#8217;s disease in over 20 years.&#160;&#160;We believe that tozadenant would be complementary to our other Phase 3 product for Parkinson's disease, CVT-301, because while tozadenant is aimed at reducing overall OFF time, CVT-301 is aimed at rapid improvement of OFF periods when they occur.&#160;&#160;We project that, if approved, tozadenant could generate peak annual U.S. net revenue of more than $400 million.&#160;&#160;Further expanding our pipeline, if we complete the acquisition we would also obtain global rights to SYN120, an oral, 5-HT6/5-HT2A dual receptor antagonist for Parkinson&#8217;s-related dementia, in Phase 2 development with support from the Michael J. Fox Foundation.&#160;&#160;Also, Biotie receives double digit royalties from sales of Selincro, a European Medicines Agency (EMA)-approved orally administered therapy for alcohol dependence therapy.&#160;&#160;Selincro has been introduced across Europe in 29&#160;countries by Biotie&#8217;s partner, H. Lundbeck A/S, a Danish pharmaceutical company specializing in central nervous system products.&#160;&#160;Selincro is not approved for use in the U.S. and is not under development for use in the U.S.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Concurrently with the announcement of the Biotie transaction, we announced two separate financing transactions.&#160;&#160;The first was a private placement of 2,250,900 shares of our common stock for an aggregate purchase price of approximately $75 million.&#160;&#160;We paid discounts and commissions of $2,250,900 in connection with the private placement, which settled on January 26, 2016.&#160;&#160;We intend to use the net proceeds from the private placement to fund, in part, the acquisition of Biotie described above.&#160;&#160;If the acquisition is not consummated for any reason, we will use all of the net proceeds from the private placement for general corporate purposes.&#160;&#160;We also announced a commitment from JPMorgan Chase, N.A. for an asset-based credit facility for up to $60 million.&#160;&#160;The closing of this credit facility transaction is expected to occur in the first quarter of 2016.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	We are focused on continuing to grow as a fully-integrated biopharmaceutical company by commercializing our FDA-approved products, developing our product candidates and advancing our research and development programs for underserved markets.&#160;&#160;We are seeking to leverage our financial strength to invest in our pipeline of research and development programs, and potentially to acquire additional products that will fit with our commercial structure and expertise in both neurology and specialty pharmaceuticals.&#160;&#160;Our goal is to create a balanced portfolio that creates significant near-term value, as well as intermediate and longer-term opportunities for further value accretion.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Company Highlights
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Ampyra
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Ampyra is the first product for which we completed clinical development.&#160;&#160;Ampyra, an extended release tablet formulation of dalfampridine (4-aminopyridine, 4-AP), was approved by the FDA in January 2010.&#160;&#160;Ampyra demonstrated efficacy in people with all four major types of MS (relapsing remitting, secondary progressive, progressive relapsing and primary progressive).&#160;&#160;To our knowledge, Ampyra is the first and only product indicated to improve walking in people with MS.&#160;&#160;Ampyra was made commercially available in the U.S. in March 2010, using our own specialty sales force, and had net revenue of $436.9 million for the year ended December 31, 2015.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Since the March 2010 launch of Ampyra, more than 110,000 people with MS in the U.S. have tried Ampyra.&#160;&#160;We believe that Ampyra is increasingly considered by many physicians a standard of care to improve walking in people with MS.&#160;&#160;As of December 31, 2015, approximately 70% of all people with MS who were prescribed Ampyra received a first refill, and approximately 40% of all people with MS who were prescribed Ampyra have been dispensed at least six months of the medicine through refills, consistent with previously reported trends.&#160;&#160;These refill rates exclude patients who started Ampyra through our First Step trial program.&#160;&#160;Our First Step program provides eligible patients with two months of Ampyra at no cost.&#160;&#160;During 2015, on average more than 70% of new Ampyra patients enrolled in First Step.&#160;&#160;The program is in its fifth year, and data show that First Step participants have higher compliance and persistency rates over time compared to non-First Step
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV ID="PGBRK" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<DIV ID="FTR">
<DIV ID="GLFTR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="PN" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS; WIDTH: 100%">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; WIDTH: 100%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	2
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; WIDTH: 100%">
<HR STYLE="COLOR: BLACK" NOSHADE SIZE="2">
</DIV>
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage7"></A>
<DIV ID="HDR">
<DIV ID="GLHDR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<A HREF="#REPORT_ANNUAL-123115_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<BR>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	pati
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE">
	ents.&#160;&#160;Approximately 50% of patients who initiate Ampyra therapy with the First Step free trial program convert to paid prescriptions.
</FONT>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Three of the largest national health plans in the U.S. &#8211; Aetna, Cigna and United Healthcare &#8211; have listed Ampyra on their commercial formulary.&#160;&#160;Approximately 75% of insured individuals in the U.S. continue to have no or limited prior authorizations, or PA&#8217;s, for Ampyra.&#160;&#160;We define limited PAs as those that require only an MS diagnosis, documentation of no contraindications, and/or simple documentation that the patient has a walking impairment; such documentation may include a Timed 25-Foot Walk (T25W) test.&#160;&#160;The access figure is calculated based on the number of pharmacy lives reported by health plans.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Approximately 400,000 people in the U.S. suffer from MS, and each year approximately 10,000 people in the U.S. are newly diagnosed.&#160;&#160;In a poll of more than 2,000 people with MS, 87% said they experienced some limitation to their walking ability and limited activities that involved walking.&#160;&#160;Among MS patients diagnosed within the last 5 years, 58% report experiencing mobility issues at least twice a week. In the European Union, over 700,000 people suffer from MS, and an additional 100,000 people in Canada are also diagnosed with this disease.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Ampyra is marketed as Fampyra outside the U.S. by Biogen International GmbH (formerly Biogen Idec International GmbH), or Biogen, under a license and collaboration agreement that we entered into in June 2009.&#160;&#160;Fampyra has been approved in a number of countries across Europe, Asia and the Americas.
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
	Biogen anticipates making Fampyra available in additional markets in 2016.&#160;&#160;Under our agreement with Biogen, we are entitled to receive double-digit tiered royalties on sales of Fampyra and we are also entitled to receive additional payments based on achievement of certain regulatory and sales milestones.&#160;&#160;We received a $25 million milestone payment from Biogen in 2011, which was triggered by Biogen&#8217;s receipt of conditional approval from the European Commission for Fampyra.&#160;&#160;The next expected milestone payment would be $15 million, due when ex-U.S. net sales exceed $100 million over four consecutive quarters.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	In October 2015, we presented 5-year post-marketing safety data for dalfampridine extended release tablets in MS at the 31
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	st
</FONT>
	Congress of the European Committee for Treatment and Research in Multiple Sclerosis (ECTRIMS) annual meeting.&#160;&#160;The data presented continue to be consistent with those reported in double-blind clinical trials, with incidence of reported seizure remaining stable over time.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Ampyra/Fampyra Patents and Legal Proceedings
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	We have five issued patents listed in the Orange Book for Ampyra, as follows:
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE ALIGN="CENTER" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" ID="HANGINGINDENT" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="">
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT;">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
<DIV>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE" FACE="SYMBOL, SERIF">
	&#183;
</FONT>
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	The first is U.S. Patent No. 8,007,826, with claims relating to methods to improve walking in patients with MS by administering 10 mg of sustained release 4-aminopyridine (dalfampridine) twice daily. Based on the final patent term adjustment calculation of the USPTO, this patent will extend into 2027.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE ALIGN="CENTER" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" ID="HANGINGINDENT" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="">
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT;">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
<DIV>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE" FACE="SYMBOL, SERIF">
	&#183;
</FONT>
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE">
	The second is U.S. Patent No. 5,540,938, the claims of which relate to methods for treating a neurological disease, such as MS, and cover the use of a sustained release dalfampridine formulation, such as AMPYRA (dalfampridine) Extended Release Tablets, 10 mg for improving walking in people with MS.&#160; In April 2013, this patent received a five year patent term extension under the patent restoration provisions of the Hatch-Waxman Act.&#160; With a five year patent term extension, this patent will&#160;expire in 2018.
</FONT>
	&#160;&#160;We have an exclusive license to this patent from Alkermes (originally with Elan, but transferred to Alkermes as part of its acquisition of Elan&#8217;s Drug Technologies business).
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE ALIGN="CENTER" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" ID="HANGINGINDENT" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="">
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT;">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
<DIV>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE" FACE="SYMBOL, SERIF">
	&#183;
</FONT>
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	The third is U.S. Patent No. 8,354,437, which includes claims relating to methods to improve walking, increase walking speed, and treat walking disability in patients with MS by administering 10 mg of sustained release 4-aminopyridine (dalfampridine) twice daily.&#160;&#160;This patent is set to expire in 2026.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

	3
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; WIDTH: 100%">
<HR STYLE="COLOR: BLACK" NOSHADE SIZE="2">
</DIV>
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage8"></A>
<DIV ID="HDR">
<DIV ID="GLHDR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<A HREF="#REPORT_ANNUAL-123115_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE ALIGN="CENTER" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" ID="HANGINGINDENT" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="">
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT;">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
<DIV>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE" FACE="SYMBOL, SERIF">
	&#183;
</FONT>
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	The fourth is U.S. Patent No. 8,440,703, which includes claims directed to methods of improving lower extremity function and walking and increasing walking speed in patients with MS by administering less than 15 mg of sustained release 4-aminopyridine (dalfampridine) twice daily.&#160;&#160;This patent is set to expire in 2025.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE ALIGN="CENTER" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" ID="HANGINGINDENT" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="">
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT;">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
<DIV>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE" FACE="SYMBOL, SERIF">
	&#183;
</FONT>
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	The fifth is U.S. Patent No. 8,663,685 with claims relating to methods to improve walking in patients with MS by administering 10 mg of sustained release 4-aminopyridine (dalfampridine) twice daily.&#160;&#160;Absent patent term adjustment, the patent is set to expire in 2025.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Ampyra also has Orphan Drug designation, which gives it marketing exclusivity in the U.S. until January 2017.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	In 2014, we received eight Paragraph IV Certification Notice Letters from generic drug manufacturers advising that they had submitted Abbreviated New Drug Applications, or ANDAs, to the FDA seeking marketing approval for generic versions of Ampyra (dalfampridine) Extended Release Tablets, 10 mg.&#160;&#160;The ANDA filers have challenged the validity of our Orange Book-listed patents for Ampyra, and they have also asserted that generic versions of their products do not infringe certain claims of these patents.&#160;&#160;In response to the filing of these ANDAs, we filed lawsuits against all of these companies alleging multiple counts of patent infringement.&#160;&#160;These lawsuits have been consolidated into a single case.&#160;&#160;The court has scheduled a Markman hearing on March 7, 2016, and has set a five day bench trial starting on September 19, 2016.&#160;&#160;This litigation is further described below in Part I, Item 3 of this report.&#160;&#160;We filed these lawsuits within 45 days from the date of receipt of each of the Paragraph IV Certification Notices.&#160;&#160;As a result, a 30 month statutory stay of approval period applies to each of the ANDAs under the Hatch-Waxman Act.&#160;&#160;The 30 month statutory stay starts from January 22, 2015, which is the end of the new chemical entity (NCE) exclusivity period for Ampyra.&#160;&#160;This restricts the FDA from approving the ANDAs until July 2017 at the earliest, unless a Federal district court issues a decision adverse to all of our asserted Orange Book-listed patents prior to that date.
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	In
</FONT>
	October and December 2015, we entered into settlement agreements with two of the generic drug manufacturers, Actavis Laboratories FL, Inc. and Aurobindo Pharma Ltd., respectively. These settlements do not resolve pending patent litigation that we brought against other ANDA filers, described in this report.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	In May 2015, we received a Paragraph IV Certification Notice from Sun Pharmaceutical Industries Ltd. and Sun Pharmaceutical Industries Inc. (&#8220;Sun&#8221;) advising that&#160;they had submitted an ANDA to the FDA seeking marketing approval for a generic version of Ampyra (dalfampridine) Extended Release Tablets, 10 mg.&#160;&#160;Sun challenged the validity of four of our five Orange Book-listed patents for Ampyra
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE">
	,
</FONT>
	and they also asserted that generic versions of their products may not infringe certain claims of these patents.&#160;&#160;In response to the filing, we filed a lawsuit against Sun in the U.S. District Court for the District of Delaware alleging multiple counts of patent infringement.&#160;&#160;In October 2015, we entered into a settlement agreement with Sun to resolve this patent litigation.&#160;&#160;The settlement with Sun does not resolve pending patent litigation that we brought against the other ANDA filers, described in this report.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	In September 2015, we received a Paragraph IV Certification Notice from Par Pharmaceutical, Inc. (&#8220;Par&#8221;) advising that it had submitted an ANDA to the FDA seeking marketing approval for a generic version of Ampyra (dalfampridine) Extended Release Tablets, 10 mg.&#160; Par challenged the validity of four of our five Orange Book-listed patents for Ampyra.&#160;&#160;In response to the filing of the ANDA, in September 2015 we filed a lawsuit against Par in the U. S. District Court for the District of Delaware asserting infringement.&#160;&#160;In January 2016, we entered into a settlement agreement with Par to resolve this patent litigation.&#160;&#160;The settlement with Par does not resolve pending patent litigation that we brought against the other ANDA filers, described in this report.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	In February 2015, a hedge fund (acting with affiliated entities and individuals and proceeding under the name of the Coalition for Affordable Drugs) filed two separate
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	inter partes
</FONT>
	review (IPR) petitions with the U.S.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<BR>
<DIV ID="PGBRK" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<DIV ID="FTR">
<DIV ID="GLFTR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="PN" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS; WIDTH: 100%">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; WIDTH: 100%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	4
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; WIDTH: 100%">
<HR STYLE="COLOR: BLACK" NOSHADE SIZE="2">
</DIV>
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage9"></A>
<DIV ID="HDR">
<DIV ID="GLHDR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<A HREF="#REPORT_ANNUAL-123115_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<BR>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Patent and Trademark Office, challenging U.S. Patent Nos. 8,663,685, and 8,007,826, which are two of the five Ampyra Orange Book-listed patents. In August 2015, the U.S. Patent and Trademark Office Patent Trials and Appeals Board ruled that it would not institute
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	inter partes
</FONT>
	review of either of these patents.&#160;&#160;In September 2015, however, the hedge fund filed two motions for reconsideration to the U.S. Patent and Trademark Office Patent Trials and Appeals Board, requesting that the denial to institute these two IPRs be reversed.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	In September 2015, the same hedge fund filed four separate IPR petitions with the U.S. Patent and Trademark Office.&#160;&#160;These new IPR petitions challenge the same two patents that were the subject of the February 2015 IPR petitions and also U.S. Patent Nos. 8,354,437 and 8,440,703.&#160;&#160;The challenged patents are four of the five Ampyra Orange-Book listed patents.&#160;&#160;We&#160;have opposed the requests to institute these IPRs, and if one or more is allowed to proceed, we will oppose the full proceedings and defend our patents. The 30 month statutory stay period based on patent infringement suits filed by us against ANDA filers is not impacted by these filings, and remains in effect.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	In 2011, the European Patent Office, or EPO, granted EP 1732548, with claims relating to, among other things, use of a sustained release aminopyridine composition, such as dalfampridine (known under the trade name Fampyra in the European Union), to increase walking speed.&#160;&#160;In March 2012, Synthon B.V. and neuraxpharm Arzneimittel GmBH filed oppositions with the EPO challenging the EP 1732548 patent.&#160;&#160;We defended the patent, and in December 2013, we announced that the EPO Opposition Division upheld amended claims in this patent covering a sustained release formulation of dalfampridine for increasing walking in patients with MS through twice daily dosing at 10 mg.&#160;&#160;Both Synthon B.V. and neuraxpharm Arzneimittel GmBH have appealed the decision.&#160;&#160;In December 2013, Synthon B.V., neuraxpharm Arzneimittel GmBH and Actavis Group PTC EHF filed oppositions with the EPO challenging our EP 2377536 patent, which is a divisional of the EP 1732548 patent.&#160;&#160;On February 24, 2016, the EPO Opposition Division rendered a decision that revoked the EP 2377536 patent.&#160;&#160;We believe the claims of this patent are valid and we have appealed the decision. Both European patents, if upheld as valid, are set to expire in 2025, absent any additional exclusivity granted based on regulatory review timelines.&#160; Fampyra also has 10 years of market exclusivity in the European Union that is set to expire in 2021.&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	We will vigorously defend our intellectual property rights.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	The ANDA and IPR litigation and legal proceedings discussed above are further described in Part I, Item 3 of this report.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	CVT-301, CVT-427 and ARCUS Technology
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	In October 2014, we acquired Civitas Therapeutics, Inc., a privately-held pharmaceutical company with global rights to CVT-301, a Phase 3 treatment candidate for OFF periods of Parkinson&#8217;s disease, or PD.&#160;&#160;Our acquisition of Civitas also included rights to Civitas&#8217; proprietary ARCUS pulmonary delivery technology, which we believe has potential applications in multiple disease areas, and a leased manufacturing facility in Chelsea, Massachusetts with commercial-scale capabilities.&#160;&#160;CVT-301 is an inhaled formulation of levodopa, or L-dopa, for the treatment of OFF periods in Parkinson&#8217;s disease. Parkinson&#8217;s disease is a progressive neurodegenerative disorder resulting from the gradual loss of certain neurons in the brain responsible for producing dopamine.&#160;&#160;The disease is characterized by symptoms such as impaired ability to move, muscle stiffness and tremor.&#160;&#160;The standard of care for the treatment of Parkinson&#8217;s disease is oral levodopa, but there are significant challenges in creating a dosing regimen that consistently maintains therapeutic effects as Parkinson&#8217;s disease progresses.&#160;&#160;The re-emergence of symptoms is referred to as an OFF period, and despite optimized regimens with current therapeutic options and strategies, OFF periods remain one of the most challenging aspects of the disease.&#160;&#160;CVT-301 is based on the proprietary ARCUS technology platform that we acquired with Civitas.&#160;&#160;The ARCUS technology is a dry-powder pulmonary delivery system that allows delivery of significantly larger doses of medication than are possible with
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV ID="PGBRK" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<DIV ID="FTR">
<DIV ID="GLFTR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="PN" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS; WIDTH: 100%">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; WIDTH: 100%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	5
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; WIDTH: 100%">
<HR STYLE="COLOR: BLACK" NOSHADE SIZE="2">
</DIV>
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage10"></A>
<DIV ID="HDR">
<DIV ID="GLHDR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<A HREF="#REPORT_ANNUAL-123115_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<BR>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	conventional dry powder formulations.&#160;&#160;This in turn provides the potential for pulmonary delivery of a much wider variety of pharmaceutical agents.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 27PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 27PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	In December 2014, we announced that the first patient has been enrolled in a Phase 3 study of CVT-301 for the treatment of OFF periods in Parkinson&#8217;s disease.&#160;&#160;We expect results from the efficacy trial in the fourth quarter of 2016, and pending timely recruitment for clinical trials, our goal is to file a new drug application, or NDA, in the U.S. in the first quarter of 2017.&#160;&#160;We are projecting that, if approved, annual peak net revenue of CVT-301 in the U.S. alone could exceed $500 million.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 27PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	In addition to CVT-301, we are exploring opportunities for other proprietary products in which inhaled delivery using our ARCUS technology can provide a significant therapeutic benefit to patients.&#160;&#160;For example, we are currently developing CVT-427, an inhaled triptan (zolmitriptan) intended for acute treatment of migraine by using the ARCUS delivery system.&#160;&#160;Triptans are the class of drug most commonly prescribed for acute treatment of migraine. Oral triptans, which account for the majority of all triptan doses, can be associated with slow onset of action and gastrointestinal challenges. The slow onset of action, usually 30&#160;minutes or longer, can result in poor response rates. Patients cite the need for rapid relief from migraine symptoms as their most desired medication attribute. Additionally, individuals with migraine may suffer from nausea and delayed gastric emptying which further impact the consistency and efficacy of the oral route of administration.
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Triptans delivered subcutaneously (injection) provide the most rapid onset of action, but are not convenient for patients.&#160;&#160;Many triptans are also available in a nasally-delivered formulation.&#160;&#160;However, based on available data, we believe that nasally-delivered triptans generally have an onset of action similar to orally administered triptans.&#160;
</FONT>
	In December 2015, we initiated and completed a Phase 1 clinical trial of CVT-427 for acute treatment of migraine.&#160;&#160;We expect to provide an update on this program by the end of the first quarter of 2016.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Plumiaz
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	We are developing Plumiaz, a proprietary nasal spray formulation of diazepam, for the treatment of people with epilepsy currently on stable regimens of antiepileptic drugs (AEDs) who experience bouts of increased seizure activity, also known as seizure clusters or acute repetitive seizures.&#160;&#160;In 2013, we submitted a New Drug Application (NDA) filing for Plumiaz to the FDA.&#160;&#160;In May 2014, the FDA issued a Complete Response Letter, or CRL, for the Plumiaz NDA.&#160;&#160;In May 2015, we announced that we completed discussions with the FDA, and are advancing development of Plumiaz.&#160;&#160;Based on these discussions, we are conducting three clinical trials for Plumiaz, which we have initiated and are currently enrolling.&#160;&#160;We are planning to resubmit the NDA for Plumiaz in the first quarter of 2017.&#160;&#160;If approved, we project peak annual U.S. net revenue of more than $200 million.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Ampyra/Dalfampridine Development Programs
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	We believe there may be potential for dalfampridine to be applied to neurological conditions in addition to MS.&#160;&#160;In December 2014, we announced that the first patient has been enrolled in a Phase 3 clinical trial of dalfampridine to evaluate the use of dalfampridine administered twice daily (BID) to improve walking in people who are suffering from chronic post-stroke walking deficits (PSWD) after experiencing an ischemic stroke.&#160;&#160;As part of the trial design, we are planning to conduct an interim analysis of the trial data in the third quarter of 2016.&#160;&#160;This analysis, combined with the results from our development efforts on a once-daily formulation of dalfampridine (described below), will establish the next steps for the program.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	We have been exploring a once-daily (QD) formulation of dalfampridine for use in the post-stroke clinical program.&#160;&#160;Based on the results of an
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	in vitro
</FONT>
	alcohol dose dumping study and a subsequent fed-fasted study, we determined that the initial QD formulation that we had been developing with an external partner was not practical for further testing.&#160;&#160;We are working with different external partners to develop a new QD formulation that could be included in future post-stroke studies.&#160;&#160;We currently have three prototypes from three different partners based on
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	in vitro
</FONT>
	testing, which do not have the alcohol dose dumping issue we identified with the initial QD formulation.&#160;&#160;All three prototypes are currently in Phase 1 pharmacokinetic studies, and we expect to provide an update on these studies by the end of the first quarter of 2016.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<BR>
<DIV ID="PGBRK" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<DIV ID="FTR">
<DIV ID="GLFTR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="PN" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS; WIDTH: 100%">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; WIDTH: 100%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	6
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; WIDTH: 100%">
<HR STYLE="COLOR: BLACK" NOSHADE SIZE="2">
</DIV>
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage11"></A>
<DIV ID="HDR">
<DIV ID="GLHDR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<A HREF="#REPORT_ANNUAL-123115_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Remyelinating Antibodies
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE">
	rHIgM22 is the lead antibody in our remyelinating antibody program, and we are developing it as a potential therapeutic for MS. We believe a therapy that could repair myelin sheaths has the potential to restore neurological function to those affected by demyelinating conditions.&#160; In April 2013, we initiated a Phase 1 clinical trial of rHIgM22 to assess the safety and tolerability of rHIgM22 in patients with MS.&#160; The study also included several exploratory clinical, imaging and biomarker measures.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE">
	We announced top-line safety and tolerability results in February 2015. The trial, which followed participants for up to six months after receiving a single dose of rHIgM22, found no dose-limiting toxicities at any of the five dose levels studied.&#160; In April 2015, we
</FONT>
	presented additional safety data from this trial at the 67th&#160;American Academy of Neurology Annual Meeting.&#160;&#160;The additional data showed that rHIgM22 was well tolerated in each of the five doses, supporting additional clinical development.&#160;&#160;In October 2015, we presented pharmacokinetics from the trial in patients with stable MS, confirming that rHIgM22 penetrates the central nervous system.&#160;&#160;This data was presented at the 31
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	st
</FONT>
	Congress of the European Committee for Treatment and Research in Multiple Sclerosis (ECTRIMS) annual meeting.&#160;&#160;
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE">
	We are advancing clinical development of rHIgM22 for MS.&#160; We are currently enrolling
</FONT>
	a Phase 1 trial using one of two doses of rHIgM22 or placebo in people with MS who are experiencing an acute relapse.&#160;&#160;In addition to assessing safety and tolerability during an acute relapse, the study includes exploratory efficacy measures such as a timed walk, magnetization transfer ratio imaging of lesion myelination in the brain and various biomarkers.
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;&#160;We expect to complete the trial in the first half of 2017.
</FONT>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Cimaglermin alfa
</FONT>
	/Neuregulins
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Cimaglermin alfa
</FONT>
	is our lead product candidate for our neuregulin program.&#160;&#160;We completed a
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE">
	cimaglermin
</FONT>
	Phase 1 clinical trial in heart failure patients.&#160;&#160;This was a dose-escalating trial designed to test the maximum tolerated single dose, with follow-up assessments at one, three, and six months.&#160;&#160;Data from this trial showed a dose-related improvement in ejection fraction in addition to safety findings.&#160;&#160;A dose-limiting toxicity was also identified in the highest planned dose cohort, specifically acute liver injury meeting Hy&#8217;s Law for drug induced hepatotoxicity, which resolved within several days.&#160;&#160;In March 2015, we presented new analyses of data from this trial at the American College of Cardiology (ACC) 64
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	th
</FONT>
	Annual Scientific Session and Expo.&#160;&#160;These analyses found that cimaglermin produced a dose-dependent benefit at multiple time points for up to three months following a single infusion.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	In 2013, we commenced a second clinical trial of
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE">
	cimaglermin
</FONT>
	.&#160;&#160;This Phase 1b single-infusion trial in people with heart failure is assessing tolerability of three dose levels of
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE">
	cimaglermin
</FONT>
	, which were tested in the first trial, and also includes assessment of drug-drug interactions and several exploratory measures of efficacy.&#160;&#160;In June 2015, we announced that we had stopped enrollment in this trial based on the occurrence of a case of hepatotoxicity (liver injury) meeting Hy&#8217;s Law criteria (elevated ALT, AST and bilirubin), based on blood test results.&#160;&#160;We also received a notification of clinical hold from the FDA following submission of this information, and the trial remains subject to this clinical hold.&#160;&#160;The abnormal blood tests resolved within several days, as was the case with the one Hy&#8217;s Law case reported in the previous Phase 1 study noted above.&#160;&#160;The 22 patients who were dosed in the trial will complete the pre-planned one year of follow up.&#160;&#160;Outside of the hepatoxicity case, the safety profile from this trial was consistent with our first Phase 1 trial, but efficacy data was inconclusive which we believe was in part due to the very small number of patients in the trial.&#160;&#160;We have ongoing analyses and non-clinical studies to investigate the biological basis for liver effects, and we will need to meet with the FDA to review these and other data from the cimaglermin studies and to request that the program be removed from clinical hold.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Corporate Update
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	We currently lease approximately 163,000 square feet of office and laboratory space in Ardsley, NY.&#160;&#160;This space includes 25,405 square feet of expansion space that we occupied in the first quarter of 2015 pursuant to expansion options in our lease for this facility.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV ID="PGBRK" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<DIV ID="FTR">
<DIV ID="GLFTR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;

<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	7
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; WIDTH: 100%">
<HR STYLE="COLOR: BLACK" NOSHADE SIZE="2">
</DIV>

<A NAME="eolPage12"></A>
<DIV ID="HDR">
<DIV ID="GLHDR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<A HREF="#REPORT_ANNUAL-123115_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</DIV>

<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	In January 2016, we engaged Burkhard Blank, M.D., to assume the responsibilities of Chief Medical Officer on an interim basis.&#160;&#160;Dr. Blank has more than 25 years of industry experience, holding senior leadership positions with responsibility for managing international clinical trial programs, as well as heading regulatory affairs, statistics, drug safety and related departments.&#160;&#160;Dr. Blank was engaged upon the departure of Enrique Carrazana, M.D., our former Chief Medical Officer.&#160;&#160;Dr. Carrazana is expected to serve as a consultant to the company for at least six (6) months following his departure.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Our Strategy
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Our strategy is to continue to grow as a fully-integrated biopharmaceutical company and to be a leading neurology company focused on the identification, development and commercialization of a range of nervous system therapeutics. We are using our scientific, clinical and commercial expertise in neurology as strategic points of access to additional nervous system markets, including stroke, Parkinson&#8217;s disease, and epilepsy. In 2016, we are focused on the following priorities:
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE ALIGN="CENTER" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" ID="HANGINGINDENT" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="">
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT;">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36PT">
<DIV>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE" FACE="SYMBOL, SERIF">
	&#183;
</FONT>
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Progressing development of our late stage programs, including: CVT-301, an inhaled formulation of levodopa, or L-dopa, using our proprietary ARCUS technology in Phase 3 development for the treatment of OFF periods in Parkinson&#8217;s disease; Plumiaz, a proprietary nasal spray formulation of diazepam, in Phase 3 development for the treatment of people with epilepsy currently on stable regimens of antiepileptic drugs (AEDs) who experience bouts of increased seizure activity, also known as seizure clusters or acute repetitive seizures; and our program evaluating the use of twice-daily (BID) dalfampridine to improve waking in people who are suffering from chronic post-stroke walking deficits (PSWD), and exploring a once daily (QD) formulation of dalfampridine for use in this program.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE ALIGN="CENTER" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" ID="HANGINGINDENT" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="">
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT;">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36PT">
<DIV>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE" FACE="SYMBOL, SERIF">
	&#183;
</FONT>
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Advancing our other clinical development programs, including:&#160;&#160;rHIgM22, a remyelinating antibody that is in Phase 1 development as a treatment for MS; and CVT-427
</FONT>
	, an inhaled triptan in Phase 1 development as&#160;an acute treatment for&#160;migraine using our ARCUS pulmonary delivery.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">

	&#160;

<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">

<DIV ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Making disciplined investments in growing sales of Ampyra, and defending our intellectual property relating to Ampyra.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">

</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE ALIGN="CENTER" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" ID="HANGINGINDENT" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="">

	&#160;

<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE" FACE="SYMBOL, SERIF">
	&#183;
</FONT>
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Completing our pending acquisition of Biotie Therapeutics, and continuing to seek opportunities to expand our pipeline through potential in-licensing and/or acquisition of neurology and/or other specialty products and technologies, focusing on late stage/near commercial or commercial products that leverage our competencies in neurology. We will also consider earlier-stage programs based on compelling science and the potential to address significant unmet medical needs
</FONT>
	.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; DISPLAY: INLINE">

</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Pending Biotie Therapies Acquisition
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	On January 19, 2016, we entered into a combination agreement to acquire Biotie Therapies Corp. for a cash purchase price of approximately $363 million.&#160;&#160;Pursuant to the combination agreement, which is further described below, we will make a public all cash tender offer in the U.S. and Finland for all of Biotie&#8217;s outstanding capital stock.&#160;&#160;If we close the tender offer pursuant to the combination agreement, we expect to complete the acquisition of the balance of any Biotie capital stock not acquired through the tender offer in the third quarter of 2016.&#160;&#160;We believe this pending acquisition is an important step in our strategic plan described above.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>

<DIV ID="PGBRK" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<DIV ID="FTR">

<A NAME="eolPage13"></A>
<DIV ID="HDR">
<DIV ID="GLHDR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<A HREF="#REPORT_ANNUAL-123115_HTM_TOC">
