<DIV ID="HDR">
<DIV ID="GLHDR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<A HREF="#REPORT_ANNUAL-123115_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<BR>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Drug Technologies business), Biogen and us, Alkermes consented to our sublicense of our rights under our agreements with Alkermes to Biogen.&#160;&#160;The three parties
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE">
	agreed to set up a committee to coordinate activities under these agreements with respect to the development, supply and commercialization of the licensed products for Biogen's territory. The Consent Agreement also amended our agreements with Alkermes by, among other things, permitting us to allow Biogen to grant sublicenses to certain unaffiliated distributors, permitting us to allow Biogen to package the licensed products and to work directly with Alkermes with respect to certain supply-related activities, and requiring Alkermes to facilitate the qualification of an alternate supplier of the licensed products under certain circumstances.
</FONT>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Regis Technologies, Inc. is the sole supplier of 4-aminopyridine, the active pharmaceutical ingredient in Ampyra.&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	If Regis experiences any disruption in their operations, a delay or interruption in the supply of our Ampyra product could result until Regis cures the problem or we locate an alternate source of supply. We may not be able to enter into alternative supply arrangements on terms that are commercially favorable, if at all. Any new supplier would also be required to qualify under applicable regulatory requirements. We could experience substantial delays before we are able to qualify any new supplier.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Zanaflex
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	We rely on Alkermes to supply us under our 2004 Supply Agreement with Zanaflex Capsules (
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE">
	and for the supply of our authorized generic Zanaflex capsules being marketed by an Allergan plc subsidiary as part of its Actavis business (originally
</FONT>
	Watson Pharma, Inc.).&#160;&#160;Patheon is our sole manufacturer of Zanaflex tablets.&#160;&#160;Farmak a.s. is the sole supplier of tizanidine hydrochloride, the active pharmaceutical ingredient, or API, in Zanaflex Capsules and Zanaflex tablets.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	The Zanaflex supply agreement with Alkermes has two year terms that automatically renew unless the agreement is terminated.&#160;&#160;Either party may terminate the agreement by notifying the other party at least 12&#160;months prior to the expiration of a renewal term. In addition, either party may terminate the agreement if the other party commits a material breach that remains uncured. If a failure to supply occurs under the agreement, other than a force majeure event, or if we terminate the supply agreement for cause, Alkermes must use commercially reasonable efforts to assist us in transferring production of Zanaflex Capsules to us or a third-party manufacturer, provided that such third party is not a technological competitor of Alkermes. If we need to transfer production, Alkermes has agreed to grant us a royalty-free, fully paid-up license of its manufacturing know-how and other information and rights related to the production of Zanaflex Capsules, including a license to use its technology for specified purposes. We have the right to sublicense this know-how to a third party manufacturer, provided that this third party is not a technological competitor of Alkermes. In the event of termination of the supply agreement due to a force majeure event that continues for more than three months, Alkermes has agreed to enter into negotiations with us to preserve the continuity of supply of products, including the possibility of transferring manufacturing of Zanaflex Capsules to us or a third party manufacturer.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	If Alkermes, Patheon, or Farmak experiences any disruption in their operations, a delay or interruption in the supply of our Zanaflex products could result until the affected supplier cures the problem or we locate an alternate source of supply. We may not be able to enter into alternative supply arrangements on terms that are commercially favorable, if at all. Any new supplier would also be required to qualify under applicable regulatory requirements. We could experience substantial delays before we are able to qualify any new supplier and transfer the required manufacturing technology to that supplier.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Qutenza
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	We acquired Qutenza from NeurogesX in 2013.&#160;&#160;NeurogesX had discontinued active promotion of Qutenza by the time of our purchase, but we re-launched the product in January 2014 using our existing commercial organization, including our specialty neurology sales force.&#160;&#160;We rely on third parties to manufacture Qutenza patches, to supply the active pharmaceutical ingredient and inactive ingredients, and to package the product.&#160;&#160;We currently have a contract with the Qutenza patch manufacturer and the supplier of the gel used with the patches but not the supplier of active pharmaceutical ingredient or the packager.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<BR>
<DIV ID="PGBRK" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<DIV ID="FTR">
<DIV ID="GLFTR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="PN" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS; WIDTH: 100%">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; WIDTH: 100%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	32
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; WIDTH: 100%">
<HR STYLE="COLOR: BLACK" NOSHADE SIZE="2">
</DIV>
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage37"></A>
<DIV ID="HDR">
<DIV ID="GLHDR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<A HREF="#REPORT_ANNUAL-123115_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Post-Stroke/Dalfampridine
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	In December 2014, we announced that the first patient has been enrolled in a Phase 3 clinical trial evaluating the use of dalfampridine administered twice-daily (BID) to improve walking in people who are suffering from chronic post-stroke walking deficits (PSWD) after experiencing an ischemic stroke.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	We have been exploring a once-daily (QD) formulation of dalfampridine for use in the post-stroke clinical program.&#160;&#160;Based on the results of an
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	in vitr
</FONT>
	o alcohol dose dumping study and a subsequent fed-fasted study, we determined that the initial QD formulation that we had been developing with an external partner was not practical for further testing.&#160;&#160;We are working with different external partners to develop a new QD formulation that could be included in future post-stroke studies.&#160;&#160;We currently have three prototypes from three different partners based on
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	in vitro
</FONT>
	testing, which do not have the alcohol dose dumping issue we identified with the initial QD formulation.&#160;&#160;All three prototypes are currently in Phase 1 pharmacokinetic studies, and we expect to provide an update on these studies by the end of the first quarter of 2016.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	We have granted Alkermes plc a right of first refusal to be our primary commercial supplier of the initial QD formulation.&#160;&#160;Should we complete development of and receive FDA approval for the initial QD formulation, we may owe royalties on sales of the product to the development company under our agreements with them.&#160;&#160;In such event, we would also owe royalties to Alkermes on sales of the product under our existing agreements with Alkermes.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	CVT-301, CVT-427 and ARCUS Technology
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 27PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 27PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Our acquisition of Civitas included its 90,000 square foot subleased manufacturing facility located in Chelsea, Massachusetts.&#160;&#160;The facility was built specifically for the commercial-scale manufacture of ARCUS products.&#160;&#160;Prior to Civitas&#8217;s acquisition of this facility from Alkermes, the facility produced more than 36&#160;million human doses of ARCUS-based products for use in clinical trials by Alkermes&#8217;s collaborator in indications other than Parkinson&#8217;s disease. Civitas subsequently took steps to recommission the facility, which has been certified by the EU regulatory authority (known as the Qualified Person, or QP, audit). Civitas has produced current good manufacturing practices, or cGMP-quality human doses of CVT-301 for Phase 1 and Phase 2 clinical trials and is now producing cGMP-quality CVT-301 powder for our ongoing Phase 3 clinical trials. As we are already at commercial scale, we believe that this will support rapid commercialization should we receive marketing approval from the FDA.
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; COLOR: #1F497D; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
	However, if we obtain approval from the FDA, we anticipate the need to expand our manufacturing operations at the Chelsea facility after product launch to meet demand depending on the timing and extent of sales growth. The ARCUS dry powder aerosol particles are generated by applying our proprietary and multi-step spray drying process to active pharmaceutical ingredient. The application of spray drying in the pharmaceutical industry is highly specialized, and the process of manufacturing ARCUS particles requires significant expertise in dry powder manufacture and handling and capsule filling.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 27PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 27PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	We have developed mature quality systems to support commercial production. As described above, we have manufactured drug product at research and development scale and we believe that we have the expertise to transfer to large, commercial scale while maintaining all relevant drug product attributes. Consequently, we believe that we will be able to ensure reliable production that meets the requirements of the FDA and other regulatory agencies.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 27PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 27PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	All CVT-301 dry powder inventory has been manufactured in-house using our cGMP process. Current data supports CVT-301 as a room temperature stable product. We have finalized drug formulation and fill weight and have also implemented final design changes for the inhaler, for which commercial molds have been produced. All raw materials used for CVT-301 manufacture are standard in pharmaceutical production. Our manufacturing team is led by individuals who are highly experienced with manufacturing of ARCUS products and other commercial products. Many of the individuals who lead our manufacturing previously manufactured ARCUS products at this facility for Alkermes.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<BR>
<DIV ID="PGBRK" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<DIV ID="FTR">
<DIV ID="GLFTR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="PN" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS; WIDTH: 100%">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; WIDTH: 100%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	33
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; WIDTH: 100%">
<HR STYLE="COLOR: BLACK" NOSHADE SIZE="2">
</DIV>
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage38"></A>
<DIV ID="HDR">
<DIV ID="GLHDR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<A HREF="#REPORT_ANNUAL-123115_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<BR>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 27PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Our proprietary inhalers are manufactured by contract manufacturers using standard manufacturing processes. We own the molds and design history files for the inhalers. The inhalers are shipped fully-assembled to us. Final design changes for the inhaler for our Phase 3 clinical trials and anticipated commercial launch have been implemented, and the molds have been produced.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Plumiaz
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	We rely on third parties for the manufacturing and packaging of this product, the nasal delivery device, and the supply of the active pharmaceutical ingredient.&#160;&#160;For commercial product, if we receive FDA approval,
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE">
	we have identified a potential manufacturer and potential suppliers, but we have not yet entered into any manufacturing or supply agreements with these companies and we cannot be certain that we can reach agreement with these companies on reasonable terms, if at all.
</FONT>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Cimaglermin alfa
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	We have completed a Phase 1 clinical trial of
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE">
	cimaglermin alfa
</FONT>
	in heart failure patients.&#160;&#160;This was a dose-escalating trial designed to test the maximum tolerated single dose, with follow-up assessments at one, three, and six months.&#160;&#160;In October 2013, we announced that the first patient had been enrolled in a second clinical trial of
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE">
	cimaglermin
</FONT>
	.&#160;&#160;This Phase 1b single-infusion trial in people with heart failure is assessing tolerability of three dose levels of
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE">
	cimaglermin
</FONT>
	, which were tested in the first trial, and also includes assessment of drug-drug interactions and several exploratory measures of efficacy.&#160;&#160;We voluntarily paused enrollment in this trial in December 2013 pending review of additional non-clinical data with the FDA.&#160;&#160;In April 2014, we announced that we had completed this review and recruitment was thereafter resumed.&#160;&#160;In June 2015 we announced that we had stopped enrollment in this trial based on the occurrence of a case of hepatotoxicity (liver injury) meeting Hy&#8217;s Law criteria (elevated ALT, AST and bilirubin), based on blood test results.&#160;&#160;We also received a notification of clinical hold from the FDA following submission of this information, and the trial remains subject to this clinical hold.&#160;&#160;The abnormal blood tests resolved within several days, as was the case with the one Hy&#8217;s Law case reported in the previous Phase 1 study noted above.&#160;&#160;The 22 patients who were dosed in the trial will complete the pre-planned one year of follow up.&#160;&#160;Outside of the hepatoxicity case, the safety profile from this trial was consistent with our first Phase 1 trial, but efficacy data was inconclusive which we believe was in part due to the very small number of patients in the trial.&#160;&#160;We have ongoing analyses and non-clinical studies to investigate the biological basis for liver effects, and we will need to meet with the FDA to review these and other data from the cimaglermin studies and to request that the program be removed from clinical hold.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	We contracted with CMC ICOS Biologics, Inc. in 2008 to produce and purify
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE">
	cimaglermin
</FONT>
	bulk material under cGMPs.&#160;&#160;Acorda and CMC Biologics have jointly developed analytical and characterization assays to support the manufacture of
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE">
	cimaglermin
</FONT>
	.&#160;&#160;The details of the manufacturing and purification processes and data from the analytical assays were provided to FDA in an IND application in March 2010.&#160;&#160;This drug substance was generated to support Good Laboratory Practices, or GLP, safety and toxicology and to support drug product manufacturing.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	The final drug product for
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE">
	cimaglermin
</FONT>
	for clinical studies was produced at Althea Technologies, now Ajinomoto Althea, Inc., under a Product Development and Clinical Supply Agreement signed in 2009, using material produced by CMC Biologics described above.&#160;&#160;The filling process and testing of the filled product was submitted to FDA as part of an IND application that was originally filed in March 2010.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	rHIgM22
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	We have a remyelinating antibodies program that we acquired under license from the Foundation for Medical Education and Research, or Mayo Clinic.&#160;&#160;Studies have demonstrated the ability of this family of antibodies to stimulate repair of the myelin sheath in three different animal models of MS.&#160;&#160;Some antibodies within this portfolio also stimulate the growth of neurons and may have applications beyond demyelinating disorders.&#160;&#160;First identified in mice, similar remyelinating antibodies were subsequently identified in human blood
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV ID="PGBRK" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<DIV ID="FTR">
<DIV ID="GLFTR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="PN" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS; WIDTH: 100%">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; WIDTH: 100%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	34
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; WIDTH: 100%">

</DIV>

<A NAME="eolPage39"></A>
<DIV ID="HDR">
<DIV ID="GLHDR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL; DISPLAY: INLINE">

</A>
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<BR>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	samples by Mayo Clinic.&#160;&#160;Our lead recombinant human remyelinating antibody, designated rHIgM22, has been produced under cGMPs, tested for safety in non-clinical studies and advanced to human trials in patients with MS.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Other Products in Development
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	We have established the internal capability to manufacture research quantities of antibody and protein product candidates.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Intellectual Property
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	We have patent portfolios relating to:&#160;&#160;Ampyra/aminopyridines; CVT-301, CVT-427 and the ARCUS technology;
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE">
	cimaglermin alfa
</FONT>
	/neuregulins; remyelinating antibodies/antibodies relating to nervous system disorders; chondroitinase; Plumiaz/diazepam nasal spray; and Qutenza and NP-1998/topical capsaicin formulations.&#160;&#160;These portfolios are comprised of both our own and in-licensed patents and patent applications. Our intellectual property also includes copyrights, confidential and trade secret information as well as a portfolio of trademarks.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Ampyra/aminopyridines
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	We have five issued patents listed in the Orange Book for Ampyra, as follows:
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE ALIGN="CENTER" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" ID="HANGINGINDENT" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="">

<DIV>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE" FACE="SYMBOL, SERIF">
	&#183;
</FONT>
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	The first is U.S. Patent No. 8,007,826, with claims relating to methods to improve walking in patients with MS by administering 10 mg of sustained release 4-aminopyridine (dalfampridine) twice daily. Based on the final patent term adjustment calculation of the United States Patent and Trademark Office, or USPTO, this patent will extend into 2027.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>

	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">

	&#183;
</FONT>
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE">
	The second is U.S. Patent No. 5,540,938, the claims of which relate to methods for treating a neurological disease, such as MS, and cover the use of a sustained release dalfampridine formulation, such as AMPYRA (dalfampridine) Extended Release Tablets, 10 mg for improving walking in people with MS.&#160; In April 2013, the patent received a five year patent term extension under the patent restoration provisions of the Hatch-Waxman Act.&#160; With a five year patent term extension, this patent will&#160;expire in 2018.
</FONT>
	&#160;&#160;We have an exclusive license to this patent from Alkermes (originally with Elan, but transferred to Alkermes as part of its acquisition of Elan&#8217;s Drug Technologies business).

</TR>

</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Our Orange Book-listed patents for Ampyra are the subject of lawsuits relating to Paragraph IV Certification Notices received from several generic drug manufacturers, and also
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	inter partes
</FONT>
	review (IPR) petitions filed by a hedge fund with the USPTO.&#160;&#160;An adverse outcome in these legal proceedings could result in our loss of some or all Orange-Book listed patents that we rely on for Ampyra.&#160;&#160;These legal proceedings are described in Part I, Item 3 of this report.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV ID="PGBRK" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<DIV ID="FTR">
<DIV ID="GLFTR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="PN" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS; WIDTH: 100%">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; WIDTH: 100%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	35
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; WIDTH: 100%">
<HR STYLE="COLOR: BLACK" NOSHADE SIZE="2">
</DIV>
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage40"></A>
<DIV ID="HDR">
<DIV ID="GLHDR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<A HREF="#REPORT_ANNUAL-123115_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<BR>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	In 2011, the European Patent Office, or EPO, granted EP 1732548, with claims relating to, among other things, use of a sustained release aminopyridine composition, such as dalfampridine (known under the trade name Fampyra in the European Union), to increase walking speed.&#160;&#160;In March 2012, Synthon B.V. and neuraxpharm Arzneimittel GmBH filed oppositions with the EPO challenging the EP 1732548 patent.&#160;&#160;We defended the patent, and in December 2013, we announced that the EPO Opposition Division upheld amended claims in this patent covering a sustained release formulation of dalfampridine for increasing walking in patients with MS through twice daily dosing at 10 mg.&#160;&#160;Both Synthon B.V. and neuraxpharm Arzneimittel GmBH have appealed the decision.&#160;&#160;In December 2013, Synthon B.V., neuraxpharm Arzneimittel GmBH and Actavis Group PTC EHF filed oppositions with the EPO challenging our EP 2377536 patent, which is a divisional of the EP 1732548 patent.&#160;&#160;On February 24, 2016, the EPO Opposition Division rendered a decision that revoked the EP 2377536 patent.&#160;&#160;We believe the claims of this patent are valid and we have appealed the decision. Both European patents, if upheld as valid, are set to expire in 2025, absent any additional exclusivity granted based on regulatory review timelines.&#160; Fampyra also has 10 years of market exclusivity in the European Union that is set to expire in 2021.&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	We will vigorously defend our intellectual property rights.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	We have pending U.S. patent applications and corresponding foreign patent applications covering various methods of using aminopyridines, such as 4-aminopyridine (dalfampridine), including applications which if issued as patents could remain in force at least through 2030 and 2032, respectively.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	CVT-301, CVT-427 and ARCUS Technology
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	The intellectual property portfolio that we acquired with Civitas has over 100 issued U.S. and foreign patents relating to CVT-301 and the ARCUS technology.&#160;&#160;This includes over 15 issued U.S. patents relating to CVT-301 directed to compositions of the drug product, the inhaler, methods of delivery of L-dopa, and manufacturing processes.&#160;&#160;The latest of the issued patents expires in 2032.&#160;&#160;The CVT-427 program, which also utilizes the ARCUS technology, has a pending application directed to formulations, which, if granted would expire in 2036 absent any patent term adjustment.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Plumiaz/Diazepam Nasal Spray
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Our wholly-owned subsidiary Neuronex, Inc. has a license from SK Biopharmaceuticals Co., Ltd., or SK, for two patent families comprising a granted U.S. patent and pending U.S. and foreign patent applications relating to diazepam intranasal formulations and uses, including the clinical formulations for Plumiaz (our trade name for Diazepam Nasal Spray).&#160;&#160;The granted U.S. patent is set to expire in 2029.&#160;&#160;If granted, the pending patent applications would expire in 2029-2032.&#160;&#160;One patent family is owned by SK and one patent family is jointly owned by Neuronex and SK.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Cimaglermin alfa
</FONT>
	/Neuregulins
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	We are the exclusive licensee under a license agreement with Paion AG (formerly CeNeS Pharmaceuticals, plc), of its worldwide portfolio of patents, patent applications and IP rights related to products of neuregulin genes, including
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE">
	cimaglermin alfa
</FONT>
	. Collectively, these patents claim the use of particular neuregulins to treat various pathophysiological conditions, particularly uses to stimulate myelinating cells in order to treat conditions of the central and peripheral nervous system that involve demyelination. These patents also claim a number of additional potential uses of neuregulins, including stimulation of growth in cardiac and mammalian muscle cells, as well as treating cardiac failure, ischemic brain events, peripheral neuropathy and nerve injury.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Our neuregulin portfolio includes a granted U.S. patent directed to using specified neuregulin sequences to treat congestive heart failure.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>

</FONT>
</DIV>

</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Remyelinating Antibodies/Antibodies Related to Nervous System Disorders
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Acorda is the exclusive licensee of a portfolio of patents and patent applications related to a series of remyelinating antibodies and their use discovered by scientists at the Mayo Clinic.&#160; This portfolio also includes pending U.S. and foreign patent applications directed to additional antibodies and their use.&#160;&#160;With regard to remyelinating antibodies, the portfolio includes U.S. issued patents directed to antibody compositions that can induce remyelination, as well as several issued related foreign counterparts.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Chondroitinase
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Our chondroitinase portfolio includes granted U.S. patents and granted foreign patent counterparts, as well as pending patent applications.&#160;&#160; The granted U.S. patents are directed to methods of using certain chondroitinase enzymes, including chondroitinase ABC-I, to reduce inflammation in patients with central nervous system (CNS) diseases, spinal cord injury (SCI) or MS and certain chondroitinase ABC-I mutant enzymes and related methods of use.&#160; The pending U.S. patent applications and their foreign counterparts are directed to chondroitinase enzymes, methods of use and formulations thereof. &#160;In particular, we have pending U.S. applications and foreign equivalents relating to chondroitinase enzymes, including fusion proteins of chondroitinase enzymes, chimeric proteins including chondroitinase enzymes, deletion mutants of chondroitinase enzymes and certain methods of use of the same.
</FONT>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	In addition, we have a license from King's College and University of Cambridge to a pending U.S. application and its foreign counterparts directed to treatment of CNS damage.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Zanaflex
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	As part of our purchase from Elan of the Zanaflex assets, we acquired one issued U.S. patent and two pending U.S. patent applications. Our issued patent is generally directed to certain methods of reducing somnolence and reducing peak plasma concentrations in patients receiving tizanidine therapy. This issued patent expires in 2021. Our two pending U.S. patent applications are directed to multiparticulate formulations of tizanidine and certain other methods of using tizanidine.&#160;&#160;We also purchased the Zanaflex trademarks in the U.S. from Elan.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	In addition, we entered into a Supply Agreement with Elan as part of the acquisition.&#160;&#160;This agreement is now with Alkermes due to Alkermes&#8217;s 2011 acquisition of Elan&#8217;s Drug Technologies business.&#160;&#160;Under this agreement, Zanaflex Capsules are manufactured for us by Alkermes using Alkermes's proprietary SODAS
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#174;
</FONT>
	technology and proprietary information. This proprietary technology is owned by Alkermes and, in the event Alkermes ceases to manufacture Zanaflex Capsules, Alkermes has agreed to grant us a royalty-free, fully paid-up license of its manufacturing know-how and other information and rights related to the production of Zanaflex Capsules, including a license to use its SODAS
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#174;
</FONT>
	technology for specified purposes. We have the right to sublicense this know-how to a third-party manufacturer, so long as this third party is not a technological competitor of Alkermes.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	In August 2007, we received a Paragraph IV Certification Notice from Apotex Inc., advising that it had submitted an Abbreviated New Drug Application, or ANDA to the FDA seeking marketing approval for generic versions of Zanaflex Capsules.&#160;&#160;In response to the filing of the ANDA, in October 2007, we filed a lawsuit against Apotex in the U.S. District Court for the District of New Jersey asserting infringement of our U.S. Patent No. 6,455,557.&#160;&#160;In September 2011, the Court ruled against us and, following our appeal, in June 2012 the U.S. Court of Appeals for the Federal Circuit affirmed the decision.&#160;&#160;We did not seek any further appeals of the decision.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Qutenza and NP-1998/Topical Capsaicin Formulations
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	We have commercialization and development rights for Qutenza and NP-1998 in the U.S., Canada, Latin America and certain other territories.&#160;&#160;In the U.S., we have one Orange Book-listed patent for Qutenza, which is
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV ID="PGBRK" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<DIV ID="FTR">
<DIV ID="GLFTR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">

<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	U.S. Patent No. 6,239,180.&#160;&#160;This patent is set to expire in 2016, absent any Hatch-Waxman extension for regulatory delays.&#160;&#160;Qutenza has Orphan Drug designation which gives it marketing exclusivity in the U.S. until 2016.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	There are granted U.S. patents which include claims directed to NP-1998 providing coverage until April 2027.&#160;&#160;There is also a pending U.S. patent application and pending foreign patent applications which, if granted, would expire in 2024.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">

<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Trademarks
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	In addition to patents, our intellectual property portfolio includes registered trademarks, along with pending trademark applications.&#160;&#160;We own several registered trademarks in the U.S. and in other countries.&#160;&#160;These registered trademarks include, in the U.S., the marks &#8220;Acorda Therapeutics,&#8221; our stylized Acorda Therapeutics logo, &#8220;Ampyra,&#8221; &#8220;Zanaflex,&#8221; &#8220;Zanaflex Capsules,&#8221; &#8220;Qutenza&#8221; and &#8220;ARCUS.&#8221;
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
	We also have trademark registrations for &#8220;Fampyra&#8221; and &#8220;Kampyra&#8221; and pending trademark applications therefore, in numerous foreign jurisdictions.&#160;&#160;In addition, our trademark portfolio includes several trademark registrations and pending trademark applications for potential product names and for disease awareness activities.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Competition
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	The market for developing and marketing pharmaceutical products is highly competitive. We are aware of many biotechnology and pharmaceutical companies that are engaged in development and/or marketing of therapeutics for a broad range of&#160;central nervous system&#160;conditions, including multiple sclerosis, or MS, stroke, Parkinson&#8217;s disease, or PD, epilepsy, heart failure, and spinal cord injury. Many of our competitors have substantially greater financial, research and development, human and other resources than we do. Furthermore, many of these companies have significantly more experience than we do in preclinical testing, human clinical trials, regulatory approval procedures and sales and marketing.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Ampyra/MS
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Current disease management approaches to MS are classified either as relapse management, disease course management, or symptom management approaches. For relapse management, the majority of neurologists treat sudden and severe relapses with a four-day course of intravenous high-dose corticosteroids. Many of these corticosteroids are available generically. For disease course management, there are a number of FDA-approved MS therapies that seek to modify the immune system. These treatments attempt to reduce the frequency and severity of exacerbations or slow the accumulation of physical disability for people with certain types of MS, though their precise mechanisms of action are not known. These products include Avonex from Biogen, Betaseron from Schering AG, Copaxone from Teva Pharmaceutical Industries,&#160;Ltd., Rebif from Merck Serono, Tysabri from Biogen and Elan, Gilenya and Extavia from Novartis AG, Aubagio from Genzyme Corporation (a Sanofi company), Glatopa from Sandoz International GmbH (a Novartis AG company), Lemtrada from Genzyme Corporation (a Sanofi company), Plegridy from Biogen, and Tecfidera from Biogen.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	To our knowledge, Ampyra is the first and only product that is approved as a treatment to improve walking in patients with MS.&#160;&#160;This was demonstrated by an increase in walking speed.
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
	Several biotechnology and pharmaceutical companies, as well as academic laboratories, are involved in research and/or product development for various neurological diseases, including MS. Other companies also have products in clinical development, including products approved for other indications in MS, to address improvement of walking ability in people with MS.
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
	BioMarin Pharmaceutical Inc. or BioMarin, acquired the rights formerly owned by EUSA Pharma (UK) Ltd. to amifampridine phosphate, a 3,4-diaminopyridine compound, which in January 2010 received marketing authorization in the EU for use in Lambert Eaton Myasthenic Syndrome, or LEMS.&#160;&#160;In 2012, BioMarin outlicensed the North American rights to Catalyst Pharmaceuticals, Inc..&#160;&#160;In the EU, and the U.S., if this product is successfully developed and approved, physicians might prescribe it instead of Ampyra, even if it were not approved for MS.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV ID="PGBRK" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<DIV ID="FTR">
<DIV ID="GLFTR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="PN" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS; WIDTH: 100%">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; WIDTH: 100%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	38
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; WIDTH: 100%">
<HR STYLE="COLOR: BLACK" NOSHADE SIZE="2">
</DIV>
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage43"></A>
<DIV ID="HDR">
<DIV ID="GLHDR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<A HREF="#REPORT_ANNUAL-123115_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<BR>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	In certain circumstances, pharmacists are not prohibited from formulating certain drug compounds to fill prescriptions on an individual patient basis, which is referred to as compounding. We are aware that at present compounded dalfampridine is used by some people with MS, and we expect that some people will continue to do this.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Several companies are engaged in developing products that include novel immune system approaches and cell therapy approaches to remyelination for the treatment of people with MS. These programs are in early stages of development and may compete with Ampyra or our preclinical candidates in the future.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	We believe that Ampyra is complementary to both the relapse management and disease course management therapies that are commercially available. Nonetheless, Ampyra may compete for market acceptance with these current treatments because they have been accepted and regularly prescribed to people with MS by physicians, or because physicians may think that these products also improve walking or other neurological functions.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.75PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Ampyra could become subject to competition from generic drug manufacturers.&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	Our Orange Book-listed patents for Ampyra are the subject of lawsuits relating to Paragraph IV Certification Notices received from several generic drug manufacturers, and also
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	inter partes
</FONT>
	review (IPR) petitions filed by a hedge fund with the U.S. Patent and Trademark Office.&#160;&#160;An adverse outcome in these legal proceedings could result in our loss of some or all Orange-Book listed patents that we rely on for Ampyra.&#160;&#160;These legal proceedings are described in Part I, Item 3 of this report.&#160;&#160;We will vigorously defend our intellectual property rights.&#160;&#160;
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE">
	We will need to devote significant resources to these legal proceedings, and if we are not successful our business could be materially harmed.&#160; We can provide no assurance concerning the duration or the outcome of these legal proceedings.
</FONT>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.75PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Zanaflex/Spasticity
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Tizanidine hydrochloride, the active pharmaceutical ingredient in Zanaflex Capsules, Zanaflex tablets and generic tizanidine hydrochloride tablets, is one of the two leading FDA-approved treatments for spasticity, a symptom suffered by, among others, both MS and SCI patients. Zanaflex tablets were approved by the FDA in 1996 and lost compound patent protection in 2002.&#160;&#160;A number of generic manufacturers of tizanidine hydrochloride are distributing their own tablet formulations.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	In 2012 Apotex Inc. launched generic tizanidine hydrochloride capsules, in 2012 we also launched an authorized generic version of Zanaflex Capsules under our agreement with an Allergan plc subsidiary (originally Watson Pharma, Inc., now part of the Actavis business owned by Allergan) and in 2013 Mylan Laboratories Limited launched generic tizanidine hydrochloride capsules.&#160;&#160;Other generic companies may also seek approval for their own generic tizanidine hydrochloride capsules.&#160;&#160;In addition, several companies have reported that they are working on potential new delivery formulations of tizanidine hydrochloride. Our net revenue from Zanaflex Capsules has declined significantly due to competition from existing generic versions, and we expect it will continue to decline in 2016 and beyond due to competition from existing and potentially other generic versions.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Baclofen, which is also available generically, is the other leading drug for the treatment of spasticity. The mechanism of action and associated effects of baclofen are different from those of tizanidine hydrochloride. Due to the different pharmacokinetic profile of Zanaflex Capsules, Zanaflex tablets and generic tizanidine hydrochloride tablets are not AB-rated with Zanaflex Capsules but Apotex&#8217;s generic tizanidine hydrochloride capsules are.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	CVT-301/Parkinson&#8217;s disease
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	We believe that the main competitors for CVT-301 are therapies that can limit the occurrence of OFF periods and other therapies for the on-demand treatment of OFF periods. These therapies include both pharmacotherapies and invasive therapies for advanced patients such as deep brain stimulation that may be used in less advanced Parkinson&#8217;s disease patients. Pharmacotherapies that can maintain consistent plasma
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<BR>
<DIV ID="PGBRK" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<DIV ID="FTR">
<DIV ID="GLFTR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="PN" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS; WIDTH: 100%">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; WIDTH: 100%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	39
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; WIDTH: 100%">
<HR STYLE="COLOR: BLACK" NOSHADE SIZE="2">
</DIV>
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage44"></A>
<DIV ID="HDR">
<DIV ID="GLHDR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<A HREF="#REPORT_ANNUAL-123115_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<BR>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	concentration of L-dopa over extended durations could reduce the occurrence of motor fluctuations and thus reduce the need for on-demand treatments for OFF periods such as CVT-301. Approaches to achieve consistent L-dopa plasma concentrations include new formulations of LD/CD, a combination of L-dopa and an inhibitor of DOPA decarboxylase (an enzyme found throughout the body) referred to as carbidopa, such as extended-release and intestinal infusions, and therapies that prolong the effect of L-dopa. Impax Laboratories has received FDA approval for RYTARY, an extended-release formulation of oral LD/CD, and extended release formulations of oral and patch LD/CD are being developed by others including Impax Depomed Inc. and NeuroDerm Ltd.&#160;&#160;Also, Abbvie Inc. has developed a continuous administration of a gel-containing L-dopa through a tube that is surgically implanted into the intestine. This therapy, known as Duopa, has been approved by the FDA and is approved in the EU. Additionally, new formulations of dopamine agonist therapies (such as pramipexole and rotigotine) may be developed that can further prolong the effect of LD/CD regimens and reduce the frequency of motor fluctuations.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE">
	If
</FONT>
	approved for the treatment of OFF periods, CVT-301 would compete against on-demand therapies that aim to specifically address OFF periods. At this time, Apokyn, an injectable formulation of apomorphine, is the only therapy approved for the treatment of OFF periods. Apokyn was approved for this use in the U.S. in 2004 and in Europe in 1993. Also, Cynapsus Therapeutics, Inc. is developing a sublingual, or under the tongue, formulation of apomorphine.&#160;&#160;This program is in Phase 3 clinical development and could potentially be commercially launched ahead of CVT-301.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	One or more of our competitors may utilize their expertise in pulmonary delivery of drugs to develop and obtain approval for pulmonary delivery products that may compete with CVT-301 and any other of our other ARCUS technology product candidates. These competitors may include smaller companies such as Alexza Pharmaceuticals, Inc., MannKind Corporation, Pulmatrix, Inc. and Vectura Group plc and larger companies such as Allergan, Inc., GlaxoSmithKline plc and Novartis AG. If approved, our product candidates may face competition in the target commercial
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	areas.
</FONT>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Plumiaz/Seizure Clusters or Acute Repetitive Seizures
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Plumiaz (Diazepam Nasal Spray) is a proprietary nasal spray formulation of diazepam that we are developing as a treatment for the management of selected, refractory patients with epilepsy, on stable regimens of antiepileptic drugs, or AEDs, who experience&#160;bouts of increased seizure activity, also known as seizure clusters or acute repetitive seizures, or ARS
<FONT STYLE="COLOR: #3B3C47; DISPLAY: INLINE; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF">
	.&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF">
	Currently, the only approved outpatient treatment for people who experience this type of seizure activity is diazepam rectal gel, a rectally administered gel formulation of diazepam.&#160;&#160;Diazepam is also available in other formulations, such as intramuscular and intravenous formulations for use in certain indications.&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Our current understanding is that many patients would prefer a therapeutic product delivered intranasally rather than delivery options of rectal or intramuscular administration, but we cannot be certain that physicians would prescribe Plumiaz in preference over other available formulations of diazepam or other products.&#160;&#160;Also, if we obtain FDA approval for and launch Plumiaz for the treatment of patients who require intermittent use of diazepam to control bouts of increased seizure activity, it may be more expensive than some or all of the generic or branded versions of diazepam otherwise available.&#160;&#160;Furthermore, we are aware that Meridian Medical Technologies, Inc. (a Pfizer subsidiary) is developing an intramuscular auto-injector for diazepam, Upsher-Smith is developing a nasal delivery form of midazolam, Neurelis, Inc. is developing a nasal delivery form of diazepam, and Alexza
</FONT>
	Pharmaceuticals, Inc.
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE">
	is developing an inhaled version of alprazolam for use by patients who experience ARS, each of which could have a labeled indication similar to Plumiaz
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;&#160;Plumiaz could be subject to substantial competition from these potential products, depending on whether and when they receive FDA approval, their cost, their labeled indications, patient acceptance, and other factors.&#160;&#160;Additionally, in May 2013, Meridian Medical Technologies, Inc. received orphan drug designation for a diazepam (autoinjector) used in management of selected, refractory patients with epilepsy on stable regimens of antiepileptic drugs, who require intermittent use of diazepam to control bouts of increased seizure activity. The product is still in clinical development and has not been approved yet.&#160;&#160;In December 2015, Neurelis, Inc. received orphan drug designation for NRL-1 (intranasal diazepam) for the treatment of acute repetitive seizures. If either of these products receives FDA approval before Plumiaz, Plumiaz will be excluded from the market for seven (7) years unless we are able to
</FONT>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV ID="PGBRK" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<DIV ID="FTR">
<DIV ID="GLFTR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="PN" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS; WIDTH: 100%">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; WIDTH: 100%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	40
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; WIDTH: 100%">
<HR STYLE="COLOR: BLACK" NOSHADE SIZE="2">
</DIV>
