<EFX_PROPERTIES>
<A NAME="FIS_PROPERTIES"></A>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<A NAME="REPORT_ANNUAL-123115_HTM_DS73301_ITEM_2__PROPERTIES_">
<!--EFPLACEHOLDER-->
</A>
<A NAME="REPORT_ANNUAL-123115_HTM_TOC_DS73301_2">
<!--EFPLACEHOLDER-->
</A>
<A NAME="REPORT_ANNUAL-123115_HTM_ITEM2">
<!--EFPLACEHOLDER-->
</A>
	Item 2.&#160;&#160;
<A NAME="REPORT_ANNUAL-123115_HTM_PROPERTIES">
<!--EFPLACEHOLDER-->
</A>
	Properties.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<A NAME="REPORT_ANNUAL-123115_HTM_DS73301_ITEM_3__LEGAL_PROCEEDINGS_">
<!--EFPLACEHOLDER-->
</A>
<A NAME="REPORT_ANNUAL-123115_HTM_TOC_DS73301_3">
<!--EFPLACEHOLDER-->
</A>
<A NAME="REPORT_ANNUAL-123115_HTM_ITEM3">
<!--EFPLACEHOLDER-->
</A>
	Ardsley, New York
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	In June 2011, we entered into a 15 year lease for an aggregate of approximately 138,000 square feet of office and laboratory space in Ardsley, New York.&#160;&#160;In July 2012, we relocated our corporate headquarters, and all employees based at our prior Hawthorne, NY location, to the Ardsley facility.&#160;&#160;We have grown substantially over the last several years, and the new facility provides state-of-the art office and laboratory space that accommodates our current needs and allows for future growth.&#160;&#160;We have options to extend the term of the lease for three additional five-year periods, and we have an option to terminate the lease after 10 years subject to payment of an early termination fee.&#160;&#160;Also, we have rights to lease up to approximately 120,000 additional square feet of space in additional buildings at the same location.&#160;&#160;Our extension, early termination, and expansion rights are subject to specified terms and conditions, including specified time periods when they must be exercised, and are also subject to limitations including that we not be in default under the lease.&#160;&#160;In 2014, we exercised our option to expand into an additional 25,405 square feet of office space, which we occupied in January 2015.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	The Ardsley lease provides for monthly payments of rent during the term. These payments consist of base rent, which takes into account the costs of the facility improvements being funded by the facility owner prior to our occupancy, and additional rent covering customary items such as charges for utilities, taxes, operating expenses, and other facility fees and charges.&#160;&#160;Our base rent is currently $4.4 million per year, which reflects an annual 2.5% escalation factor as well as our recent expansion, described above.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Chelsea, Massachusetts
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Our 2014 acquisition of Civitas included a subleased manufacturing facility in Chelsea, Massachusetts with commercial-scale capabilities.&#160;&#160;The approximately 90,000 square foot facility also includes office and laboratory space.&#160;&#160;Civitas, now our wholly-owned subsidiary, previously subleased the Chelsea, Massachusetts facility from Alkermes, Inc., which leased the facility from the owner, H&amp;N Associates, LLC.&#160;&#160;The Civitas sublease and Alkermes head lease were scheduled to expire on December 31, 2015, but in the first quarter of 2015 Civitas and Alkermes exercised options that extended the terms of the sublease and head lease for five additional years, until December 31, 2020.&#160;&#160;In the fourth quarter of 2015, Civitas entered into an assignment and amendment of the head lease with Alkermes and H&amp;N Associates pursuant to which, among other things, Civitas became the direct lessee of the Chelsea facility from H&amp;N Associates under the terms and conditions of the Alkermes head lease, as modified by the assignment and amendment.&#160;&#160;Pursuant to the assignment and amendment, the term of the head lease has been extended an additional five years, to December 31, 2025, and Civitas has two additional extension options of five years each.&#160;&#160;The assignment and amendment also specifies the rent during the current extended term, as well as during the additional extension periods should Civitas exercise its options for those extension periods.&#160;&#160;The base annual rent under the head lease is currently $1.0 million per year.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</EFX_PROPERTIES>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<EFX_LEGAL_PROCEEDINGS>
<A NAME="FIS_LEGAL_PROCEEDINGS"></A>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Item 3.&#160;&#160;
<A NAME="REPORT_ANNUAL-123115_HTM_LEGALPROCEEDINGSUPDATE">
<!--EFPLACEHOLDER-->
</A>
	Legal Proceedings.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	A
</FONT>
	potex
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	In August 2007, we received a Paragraph IV Certification Notice from Apotex Inc., advising that it had submitted an Abbreviated New Drug Application, or ANDA, to the FDA seeking marketing approval for generic versions of Zanaflex Capsules.&#160;&#160;In response to the filing of the ANDA, in October 2007, we filed a lawsuit against Apotex in the U.S. District Court for the District of New Jersey asserting infringement of our U.S. Patent No. 6,455,557.&#160;&#160;In September 2011, the Court ruled against us and, following our appeal, in June 2012 the U.S. Court of Appeals for the Federal Circuit affirmed the decision.&#160;&#160;We did not seek any further appeal of the decision.&#160;&#160;On September 6, 2011, we filed a citizen petition with the FDA requesting that the FDA not approve Apotex&#8217;s ANDA because of public-safety concerns about Apotex&#8217;s proposed drug.&#160;&#160;On December 2, 2011, Apotex filed suit against us in the U.S. District Court for the Southern District of New York.&#160;&#160;In that suit, Apotex alleged, among other claims, that we engaged in anticompetitive behavior and false advertising in connection with the
</FONT>
</DIV>
<BR>
<DIV ID="PGBRK" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<DIV ID="FTR">
<DIV ID="GLFTR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="PN" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS; WIDTH: 100%">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; WIDTH: 100%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	83
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; WIDTH: 100%">
<HR STYLE="COLOR: BLACK" NOSHADE SIZE="2">
</DIV>
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage88"></A>
<DIV ID="HDR">
<DIV ID="GLHDR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<A HREF="#REPORT_ANNUAL-123115_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<BR>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	development and marketing of Zanaflex Capsules, including that the citizen petition we filed with the FDA delayed FDA approval of Apotex&#8217;s generic tizanidine capsules.&#160;&#160;On January 26, 2012, we moved to dismiss or stay Apotex&#8217;s suit.&#160;&#160;On February 3, 2012, the FDA denied the citizen petition that we filed and approved Apotex&#8217;s ANDA for a generic version of Zanaflex Capsules.&#160;&#160;On February 21, 2012, Apotex filed an amended complaint that incorporated the FDA action, but otherwise made allegations similar to the original complaint.&#160;&#160;Requested judicial remedies include monetary damages, disgorgement of profits, recovery of litigation costs, and injunctive relief.&#160;&#160;Following our filing of a motion to dismiss the amended complaint, in 2013 the Court dismissed five of the six counts in the amended complaint, including all of the antitrust claims, leaving only a claim under the Lanham Act relating to alleged product promotional activities.&#160;&#160;In October 2014, the Court granted our motion for summary judgment against Apotex&#8217;s remaining claim.&#160;&#160;Apotex has appealed both the motion to dismiss and summary judgment decisions to the Second Circuit Court of Appeals.&#160;&#160;The briefing period and oral argument have been completed and we are now awaiting a decision from the Second Circuit Court of Appeals. The Company will defend itself vigorously throughout the appeal process.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Ampyra ANDA Litigation
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	In June and July of 2014, we received eight separate Paragraph IV Certification Notices from Accord Healthcare, Inc., Actavis Laboratories FL, Inc. (&#8220;Actavis&#8221;), Alkem Laboratories Ltd., Apotex, Inc., Aurobindo Pharma Ltd. ("Aurobindo"), Mylan Pharmaceuticals, Inc., Roxane Laboratories, Inc., and Teva Pharmaceuticals USA, Inc., advising that each of these companies had submitted an ANDA to the FDA seeking marketing approval for generic versions of Ampyra (dalfampridine) Extended Release Tablets, 10 mg.&#160;&#160;The ANDA filers have challenged the validity of our Orange Book-listed patents for Ampyra, and they have also asserted that generic versions of their products do not infringe certain claims of these patents.&#160;&#160;In response to the filing of these ANDAs, in July 2014, we filed lawsuits against these generic pharmaceutical manufacturing companies in the U.S. District Court for the District of Delaware asserting infringement of our U.S. Patent Nos. 5,540,938, 8,007,826, 8,354,437, 8,440,703, and 8,663,685.&#160;&#160;Requested judicial remedies include recovery of litigation costs and injunctive relief, including a request that the effective date of any FDA approval for these generic companies to make, use, offer for sale, sell, market, distribute, or import the proposed generic products be no earlier than the dates on which the Ampyra Orange-Book listed patents expire, or any later expiration of exclusivity to which we are or become entitled.&#160;&#160; These lawsuits with the eight ANDA filers have been consolidated into a single case.&#160;&#160;The U.S. District Court for the District of Delaware has scheduled a Markman hearing on March 7, 2016, and has set a five day bench trial starting on September 19, 2016.&#160;&#160;The Markman hearing will be conducted to determine the scope and limitations of certain patent claims that are asserted in the litigation.&#160;&#160;We filed these lawsuits within 45 days from the date of receipt of each of the Paragraph IV Certification Notices.&#160;&#160;As a result, a 30 month statutory stay of approval period applies to each of the ANDAs under the Hatch-Waxman Act.&#160;&#160;The 30 month stay starts from January 22, 2015, which is the end of the new chemical entity (NCE) exclusivity period for Ampyra.&#160;&#160;This restricts the FDA from approving the ANDAs until July 2017 at the earliest, unless a Federal district court issues a decision adverse to all of our asserted Orange Book-listed patents prior to that date.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	In October and December 2015, we entered into&#160;settlement agreements with Actavis and Aurobindo&#160;to resolve the patent litigation&#160;that we brought against&#160;them in the U.S. District Court for the District of Delaware, described above.&#160;&#160;As a result of the settlement agreements, Actavis and Aurobindo will be permitted to market&#160;generic versions of Ampyra in the U.S. at a specified date in 2027, or potentially earlier under certain circumstances. The Court entered an order dismissing the case against Actavis without prejudice on October 21, 2015.&#160; As a result of the settlement agreement with Aurobindo, and upon the request of the parties, the&#160;Court entered a Consent Order, in which it dismissed our litigation against&#160;Aurobindo on December 22, 2015.
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
	The parties have submitted the agreements to the Federal Trade Commission and the Department of Justice, as required by federal law.&#160;&#160;The settlements with Actavis and Aurobindo&#160;do not resolve pending patent litigation that we brought against the other ANDA filers, as described in this report.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	In August 2014, Mylan Pharmaceuticals, Inc. and its parent, Mylan, Inc. (collectively, &#8220;Mylan&#8221;), filed a motion challenging the jurisdiction of the U.S. District Court for the District of Delaware.&#160;&#160;On January 14, 2015, the Court denied Mylan&#8217;s motion to dismiss with respect to the ANDA filer, Mylan Pharmaceuticals, Inc.&#160;&#160;On January 30, 2015, the Court granted Mylan&#8217;s request for an interlocutory appeal of its jurisdictional decision to the Federal Circuit Court of Appeals.&#160;&#160;The parties presented oral arguments on the appeal in January 2016, and we are waiting for a decision on the appeal from the Court.&#160;&#160;The Company will defend itself vigorously throughout
</FONT>
</DIV>
<BR>
<DIV ID="PGBRK" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<DIV ID="FTR">
<DIV ID="GLFTR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="PN" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS; WIDTH: 100%">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; WIDTH: 100%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	84
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; WIDTH: 100%">
<HR STYLE="COLOR: BLACK" NOSHADE SIZE="2">
</DIV>
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage89"></A>
<DIV ID="HDR">
<DIV ID="GLHDR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<A HREF="#REPORT_ANNUAL-123115_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<BR>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	the appeal process.&#160;&#160;Due to Mylan&#8217;s motion to dismiss, we also filed another patent infringement suit against Mylan in the U.S. District Court for the Northern District of West Virginia asserting the same U.S. Patents and requesting the same judicial relief as in the Delaware action. On December 17, 2014, we filed a motion in the Northern District of West Virginia to stay that action in deference to the Delaware proceeding and until the issue of jurisdiction has been decided.&#160; On February 11, 2014, the District Court for the Northern District of West Virginia granted our motion to stay the proceeding in that district until the Federal Circuit Court of Appeals decides Mylan&#8217;s appeal of Delaware&#8217;s jurisdictional decision.&#160; The patent infringement case against Mylan, however, is still proceeding in Delaware along with the cases against the other eight ANDA filers (see below) at the present time.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	In May&#160;2015, we received a Paragraph IV Certification Notice from Sun Pharmaceutical Industries Limited and Sun Pharmaceuticals Industries Inc. (&#8220;Sun&#8221;) advising that&#160;they had submitted an ANDA to the FDA seeking marketing approval for a generic version of Ampyra (dalfampridine) Extended Release Tablets, 10 mg.&#160; Sun&#160;challenged the validity of four of our five Orange Book-listed patents for Ampyra, and did not file against our U.S. Patent No. 5,540,938, and also asserted that generic versions of their products may not infringe certain claims of these patents.&#160;&#160;In response to the filing of the ANDA, in May 2015 we filed a lawsuit against Sun in the U. S. District Court for the District of Delaware asserting infringement of our U.S. Patent Nos. 8,007,826, 8,354,437, 8,440,703, and 8,663,685, which was within the 45 days from the date of receipt of Sun&#8217;s Paragraph IV Certification Notice which instituted the 30 month statutory stay of approval period to the Sun&#160;ANDA under the Hatch-Waxman Act.&#160; In October 2015, we entered into a settlement agreement with Sun to resolve this patent litigation.&#160;&#160;As a result of the settlement agreement, Sun will be permitted to market a generic version of Ampyra in the U.S. at a specified date in 2027, or potentially earlier under certain circumstances. As a result of the settlement agreement, and upon the request of the&#160;parties, the&#160;Court entered a Consent Order, in which it dismissed our litigation against Sun on October 29, 2015.&#160;&#160;The parties have submitted the agreement to the Federal Trade Commission and the Department of Justice, as required by federal law.&#160;&#160;The settlement with Sun does not resolve pending patent litigation that we brought against the other ANDA filers, described in this report.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	In September 2015, we received a Paragraph IV Certification Notice from Par Pharmaceutical, Inc. (&#8220;Par&#8221;) advising that it had submitted an ANDA to the FDA seeking marketing approval for a generic version of Ampyra (dalfampridine) Extended Release Tablets, 10 mg.&#160; Par challenged the validity of four of our five Orange Book-listed patents for Ampyra, and did not file against our U.S. Patent No. 5,540,938, and they have also asserted that generic versions of its products may not infringe certain claims of these patents.&#160;&#160;In response to the filing of the ANDA, in September 2015 we filed a lawsuit against Par in the U. S. District Court for the District of Delaware asserting infringement of our U.S. Patent Nos. 8,007,826, 8,354,437, 8,440,703, and 8,663,685.&#160; In January 2016, we entered into a settlement agreement with Par to resolve this patent litigation.&#160;&#160;As a result of the settlement agreement, Par will be permitted to market a generic version of Ampyra in the U.S. at a specified date in 2027, or potentially earlier under certain circumstances. As a result of the settlement agreement, and upon the request of the parties,&#160;the Court entered a Consent Order, in which it dismissed our litigation against Par on January 21, 2016.&#160;&#160;The parties have submitted the agreement to the Federal Trade Commission and the Department of Justice, as required by federal law.
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
	The settlement with Par does not resolve pending patent litigation that we brought against the other ANDA filers, described in this report.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Ampyra IPR Proceedings
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	In February 2015, a hedge fund (acting with affiliated entities and individuals and proceeding under the name of the Coalition for Affordable Drugs) filed two separate
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	inter partes
</FONT>
	review (IPR) petitions with the U.S. Patent and Trademark Office, or PTO, challenging U.S. Patent Nos. 8,663,685, and 8,007,826, which are two of the five Ampyra Orange Book-listed patents.&#160;&#160;In August 2015, the U.S. Patent and Trademark Office Patent Trials and Appeals Board ruled that it would not institute
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	inter partes
</FONT>
	review of either of these patents.&#160;&#160;On September 23, 2015, however, the hedge fund filed two motions for reconsideration to the U.S. Patent and Trademark Office Patent Trials and Appeals Board, requesting that the denial to institute these two IPRs be reversed.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<BR>
<DIV ID="PGBRK" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<DIV ID="FTR">
<DIV ID="GLFTR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="PN" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS; WIDTH: 100%">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; WIDTH: 100%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	85
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; WIDTH: 100%">
<HR STYLE="COLOR: BLACK" NOSHADE SIZE="2">
</DIV>
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage90"></A>
<DIV ID="HDR">
<DIV ID="GLHDR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<A HREF="#REPORT_ANNUAL-123115_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<BR>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	On September 2 and 3, 2015, the same hedge fund filed four separate IPR petitions with the PTO.&#160;&#160;These new IPR petitions challenge the same two patents that were the subject of the February 2015 IPR petitions and also U.S. Patent Nos. 8,354,437 and 8,440,703.&#160;&#160;The challenged patents are four of the five Ampyra Orange-Book listed patents.&#160;&#160;We have opposed the requests to institute these IPRs, and if one or more is allowed to proceed, we will oppose the full proceedings and defend our patents.&#160;&#160;We are expecting a decision from the PTO&#8217;s Patent Trials and Appeals Board in March 2016 on whether or not it will allow these IPR petitions to proceed.&#160;&#160;The 30-month statutory stay period based on patent infringement suits filed by Acorda against ANDA filers is not impacted by these filings, and remains in effect.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	We will vigorously defend our intellectual property rights.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</EFX_LEGAL_PROCEEDINGS>

<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<A NAME="REPORT_ANNUAL-123115_HTM_PARTII">

	PART II
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<EFX_MARKET>
<A NAME="FIS_MARKET"></A>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<A NAME="REPORT_ANNUAL-123115_HTM_ITEM5">
<!--EFPLACEHOLDER-->
</A>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Item 5
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	.&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<A NAME="REPORT_ANNUAL-123115_HTM_MARKETFORREGISTRANTSECURITIES">
<!--EFPLACEHOLDER-->
</A>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Market for Registrant&#8217;s Common Equity, Related Stockholder Matters and Issuer Purchases of Equity Securities
</FONT>
	.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Our common stock has been quoted on the NASDAQ Global Market under the symbol ACOR since our initial public offering on February 9, 2006. Prior to that date, there was no public market for our common stock. The following table sets forth, for the periods indicated, the high and low bid prices per share of our common stock as reported on the NASDAQ Global Market.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;

<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	The following graph compares the cumulative five-year total return attained by stockholders on Acorda Therapeutics, Inc.&#8217;s common stock relative to the cumulative total returns of the NASDAQ Composite index and the NASDAQ Biotechnology index. An investment of $100 is assumed to have been made in our common stock and in each of the indexes on December 31, 2010 and its relative performance is tracked through December 31, 2015.

	Dividend Policy
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	We have never declared or paid cash dividends on our common stock. We do not anticipate paying any cash dividends on our capital stock in the foreseeable future. We currently intend to retain all available funds and any future earnings to fund the development and growth of our business.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Sales of Unregistered Securities
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	On January 19, 2016, we agreed to issue 2,250,900 shares of our common stock to JP Morgan Securities LLC, as initial purchaser, in a private placement transaction exempt from registration under the Securities Act of 1933, as amended (the &#8220;Securities Act&#8221;). The settlement of the shares with the initial purchaser occurred on January 26, 2016.&#160;&#160;The shares were issued to the initial purchaser in reliance on the exemption afforded by
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;

<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Section 4(a)(2) under the Securities Act.&#160;&#160;The aggregate offering price for the sale of the shares to the initial purchaser was $74,999,988.&#160;&#160;In connection with the private placement, we paid $2,250,900 in aggregate discounts and commissions.&#160;&#160;We intend to use the net proceeds from the issuance of the shares to fund, in part, the acquisition of Biotie described above in this report.&#160;&#160;If the acquisition of Biotie is not consummated for any reason, we will use all of the net proceeds from the issuance of the shares for general corporate purposes. The shares will not be registered under the Securities Act or any state securities laws and may not be offered or sold in the U.S. absent an effective registration statement or an applicable exemption from registration requirements or a transaction not subject to the registration requirements of the Securities Act or any state securities laws.
</FONT>
</DIV>

	Acorda did not repurchase any shares of its Common Stock during the fiscal year ended December 31, 2015.&#160;&#160;Acorda has not announced any plans or programs for the repurchase of its Common Stock.

<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; DISPLAY: INLINE">

</A>
	Item 6.&#160;&#160;
<A NAME="REPORT_ANNUAL-123115_HTM_SELECTEDFINANCIALDATA">
<!--EFPLACEHOLDER-->
</A>
	Selected Financial Data.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	The following unaudited selected consolidated financial data for each of the five years in the period ended December 31, 2015 are derived from our audited consolidated financial statements. These data should be read in conjunction with our audited consolidated financial statements and related notes that are included elsewhere in this Annual Report on Form&#160;10-K and with &#8220;Management&#8217;s Discussion and Analysis of Financial Condition and Results of Operations&#8221; included in Item 7 below.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>

</TD>
<TD ALIGN="RIGHT" VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="1%">

</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 10.25PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 9PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	On December 31, 2015, the Company early adopted the provisions of Accounting Standards updated 2015-17, &#8220;Income Taxes&#8221; (Topic 740): Balance Sheet Classification of Deferred Taxes (ASU 2015-17), which simplifies the presentation of deferred income taxes by requiring that deferred tax liabilities and assets be classified as noncurrent in the balance sheet. The Company adopted the new guidance retrospectively and updated the classification of the deferred tax liabilities and assets to noncurrent in the balance sheet for the current year and all prior periods presented.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</EFX_FINANCIAL_DATA>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 10.25PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<EFX_MANAGEMENTS_DISCUSSION>
<A NAME="FIS_MANAGEMENTS_DISCUSSION"></A>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<A NAME="REPORT_ANNUAL-123115_HTM_ITEM7">
<!--EFPLACEHOLDER-->
</A>
	Item 7.&#160;&#160;
<A NAME="REPORT_ANNUAL-123115_HTM_MDA">
<!--EFPLACEHOLDER-->
</A>
	Management&#8217;s Discussion and Analysis of Financial Condition and Results of Operations.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	The following discussion and analysis of our consolidated financial condition and results of operations should be read in conjunction with our audited consolidated financial statements and related notes included in this Annual Report on Form&#160;10-K.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Background
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	We are a biopharmaceutical company dedicated to the identification, development and commercialization of novel therapies that restore function and improve the lives of people with neurological disorders.&#160;&#160;We market three FDA-approved therapies, including Ampyra (dalfampridine) Extended Release Tablets, 10 mg, a treatment to improve walking in patients with multiple sclerosis, or MS, as demonstrated by an increase in walking speed. We have one of the leading pipelines in the industry of novel neurological therapies.&#160;&#160;We are currently developing a number of clinical and preclinical stage therapies.&#160;&#160;This pipeline addresses a range of disorders, including chronic post-stroke walking deficits (PSWD), Parkinson&#8217;s disease, epilepsy, heart failure, MS, and spinal cord injury.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Ampyra
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	General
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Ampyra was approved by the FDA in January 2010 for the improvement of walking in people with MS. To our knowledge, Ampyra is the first and only drug approved for this indication. Efficacy was shown in people with all four major types of MS (relapsing remitting, secondary progressive, progressive relapsing and primary progressive).&#160;&#160;Ampyra was made commercially available in the United States in March 2010.&#160;&#160;Net revenue for Ampyra was $436.9 million for the year ended December 31, 2015 and $366.2 million for the year ended December 31, 2014.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Since the March 2010 launch of Ampyra, more than 110,000 people with MS in the U.S. have tried Ampyra.&#160;&#160;We believe that Ampyra is increasingly considered by many physicians a standard of care to improve walking in people with MS.&#160;&#160;As of December 31, 2015, approximately 70% of all people with MS who were
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV>
<DIV ID="PGBRK" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<DIV ID="FTR">
<DIV ID="GLFTR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="PN" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS; WIDTH: 100%">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; WIDTH: 100%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	91
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; WIDTH: 100%">
<HR STYLE="COLOR: BLACK" NOSHADE SIZE="2">
</DIV>
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage96"></A>
<DIV ID="HDR">
<DIV ID="GLHDR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<A HREF="#REPORT_ANNUAL-123115_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	prescribed Ampyra received a first refill, and approximately 40% of all people with MS who were prescribed Ampyra have been dispensed at least six months of the medicine through refills, consistent with previously reported trends.&#160;&#160;These refill rates exclude patients who started Ampyra through our First Step trial program.&#160;&#160;Our First Step program provides eligible patients with two months of Ampyra at no cost.&#160;&#160;During 2015, on average more than 70% of new Ampyra patients were enrolled in First Step.&#160;&#160;The program is in its fifth year, and data show that First Step participants have higher compliance and persistency rates over time compared to non-First Step pati
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE">
	ents.&#160;&#160;Approximately 50% of patients who initiate Ampyra therapy with the First Step free trial program convert to paid prescriptions.
</FONT>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Ampyra is marketed in the U.S. through our own specialty sales force and commercial infrastructure. We currently have approximately 90 sales representatives in the field calling on a priority target list of approximately 7,000 physicians.&#160;&#160;We also have established teams of Medical Science Liaisons, Regional Reimbursement Directors, and Market Access Account Directors who provide information and assistance to payers and physicians on Ampyra; National Trade Account Managers who work with our limited network of specialty pharmacies; and Market Development Managers who work collaboratively with field teams and corporate personnel to assist in the execution of the Company&#8217;s strategic initiatives.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Ampyra is distributed in the U.S. exclusively through a limited network of specialty pharmacy providers that deliver the medication to patients by mail; Kaiser Permanente, which distributes Ampyra to patients through a closed network of on-site pharmacies; and ASD Specialty Healthcare, Inc. (an AmerisourceBergen affiliate), which distributes Ampyra to the U.S. Bureau of Prisons, the U.S. Department of Defense, the U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs, or VA, and other federal agencies.&#160;&#160;All of these customers are contractually obligated to hold no more than an agreed number of days of inventory, ranging from 10 to 30 calendar days.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	We have contracted with a third party organization with extensive experience in coordinating patient benefits to run Ampyra Patient Support Services, or APSS, a dedicated resource that coordinates the prescription process among healthcare providers, people with MS, and insurance carriers.&#160;&#160;Processing of most incoming requests for prescriptions by APSS begins within 24 hours of receipt. Patients will experience a range of times to receive their first shipment based on the processing time for insurance requirements. As with any prescription product, patients who are members of benefit plans that have restrictive prior authorizations may experience delays in receiving their prescription.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Three of the largest national health plans in the U.S. &#8211; Aetna, Cigna and United Healthcare &#8211; have listed Ampyra on their commercial formulary.&#160;&#160;Approximately 75% of insured individuals in the U.S. continue to have no or limited prior authorizations, or PA&#8217;s, for Ampyra.&#160;&#160;We define limited PAs as those that require only an MS diagnosis, documentation of no contraindications, and/or simple documentation that the patient has a walking impairment; such documentation may include a Timed 25-Foot Walk (T25W) test.&#160;&#160;The access figure is calculated based on the number of pharmacy lives reported by health plans.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	In October 2015, we presented 5-year post-marketing safety data for dalfampridine extended release tablets in MS at the 31
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	st
</FONT>
	Congress of the European Committee for Treatment and Research in Multiple Sclerosis (ECTRIMS) annual meeting.&#160;&#160;The data presented continue to be consistent with those reported in double-blind clinical trials, with incidence of reported seizure remaining stable over time.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	License and Collaboration Agreement with Biogen
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Ampyra is marketed as Fampyra outside the U.S. by Biogen International GmbH (formerly Biogen Idec International GmbH), or Biogen, under a license and collaboration agreement that we entered into in June 2009.&#160;&#160;Fampyra has been approved in a number of countries across Europe, Asia and the Americas.
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
	Biogen anticipates making Fampyra available in additional markets in 2016.&#160;&#160;Under our agreement with Biogen, we are entitled to receive double-digit tiered royalties on sales of Fampyra and we are also entitled to receive additional payments based on achievement of certain regulatory and sales milestones.&#160;&#160;We received a $25 million milestone payment from Biogen in 2011, which was triggered by Biogen&#8217;s receipt of conditional approval from the European
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<DIV ID="PGBRK" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<DIV ID="FTR">
<DIV ID="GLFTR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>

	92

<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Commission for Fampyra.&#160;&#160;The next expected milestone payment would be $15 million, due when ex-U.S. net sales exceed $100 million over four consecutive quarters.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Ampyra Patent Update
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	We have five issued patents listed in the Orange Book for Ampyra, as follows:
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE ALIGN="CENTER" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" ID="HANGINGINDENT" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="">
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT;">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
<DIV>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE" FACE="SYMBOL, SERIF">
	&#183;
</FONT>
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	The first is U.S. Patent No. 8,007,826, with claims relating to methods to improve walking in patients with MS by administering 10 mg of sustained release 4-aminopyridine (dalfampridine) twice daily. Based on the final patent term adjustment calculation of the United States Patent and Trademark Office, or USPTO, this patent will extend into 2027.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE ALIGN="CENTER" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" ID="HANGINGINDENT" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="">
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT;">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
<DIV>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE" FACE="SYMBOL, SERIF">
	&#183;
</FONT>
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE">
	The second is U.S. Patent No. 5,540,938, the claims of which relate to methods for treating a neurological disease, such as MS, and cover the use of a sustained release dalfampridine formulation, such as AMPYRA (dalfampridine) Extended Release Tablets, 10 mg for improving walking in people with MS.&#160; In April 2013, this patent received a five year patent term extension under the patent restoration provisions of the Hatch-Waxman Act.&#160; With a five year patent term extension, this patent will&#160;expire in 2018.
</FONT>
	&#160;&#160;We have an exclusive license to this patent from Alkermes (originally with Elan, but transferred to Alkermes as part of its acquisition of Elan&#8217;s Drug Technologies business).
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE ALIGN="CENTER" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" ID="HANGINGINDENT" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="">
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT;">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
<DIV>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE" FACE="SYMBOL, SERIF">
	&#183;
</FONT>
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	The third is U.S. Patent No. 8,354,437, which includes claims relating to methods to improve walking, increase walking speed, and treat walking disability in patients with MS by administering 10 mg of sustained release 4-aminopyridine (dalfampridine) twice daily.&#160;&#160;This patent is set to expire in 2026.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>

<DIV>
<TABLE ALIGN="CENTER" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" ID="HANGINGINDENT" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="">

	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>

<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">

	&#183;

<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	The fourth is U.S. Patent No. 8,440,703, which includes claims directed to methods of improving lower extremity function and walking and increasing walking speed in patients with MS by administering less than 15 mg of sustained release 4-aminopyridine (dalfampridine) twice daily.&#160;&#160;This patent is set to expire in 2025.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>

<DIV>
<TABLE ALIGN="CENTER" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" ID="HANGINGINDENT" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="">
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT;">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
<DIV>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE" FACE="SYMBOL, SERIF">
	&#183;
</FONT>
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	The fifth is U.S. Patent No. 8,663,685 with claims relating to methods to improve walking in patients with MS by administering 10 mg of sustained release 4-aminopyridine (dalfampridine) twice daily.&#160;&#160;Absent patent term adjustment, the patent is set to expire in 2025.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Ampyra also has Orphan Drug designation, which gives it marketing exclusivity in the U.S. until January 2017.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Our Orange Book-listed patents for Ampyra are the subject of lawsuits relating to Paragraph IV Certification Notices received from several generic drug manufacturers, and also
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	inter partes
</FONT>
	review (IPR) petitions filed by a hedge fund with the U.S. Patent and Trademark Office.&#160;&#160;An adverse outcome in these legal proceedings could result in our loss of some or all Orange-Book listed patents that we rely on for Ampyra.&#160;&#160;These legal proceedings are described in Part I, Item 3 of this report.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	In 2011, the European Patent Office, or EPO, granted EP 1732548, with claims relating to, among other things, use of a sustained release aminopyridine composition, such as dalfampridine (known under the trade name Fampyra in the European Union), to increase walking speed.&#160;&#160;In March 2012, Synthon B.V. and neuraxpharm Arzneimittel GmBH filed oppositions with the EPO challenging the EP 1732548 patent.&#160;&#160;We defended the patent, and in December 2013, we announced that the EPO Opposition Division upheld amended claims in this patent covering a sustained release formulation of dalfampridine for increasing walking in patients with MS through twice daily dosing at 10 mg.&#160;&#160;Both Synthon B.V. and neuraxpharm Arzneimittel GmBH have appealed the decision.&#160;&#160;In December 2013, Synthon B.V., neuraxpharm Arzneimittel GmBH and Actavis Group PTC EHF filed oppositions with the EPO challenging our EP 2377536 patent, which is a divisional of the EP 1732548 patent.&#160;&#160;On February 24, 2016, the EPO Opposition Division rendered a decision that revoked the EP 2377536 patent.&#160;&#160;We
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<DIV ID="PGBRK" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<DIV ID="FTR">
<DIV ID="GLFTR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="PN" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS; WIDTH: 100%">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; WIDTH: 100%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	93
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; WIDTH: 100%">
<HR STYLE="COLOR: BLACK" NOSHADE SIZE="2">
</DIV>
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage98"></A>
<DIV ID="HDR">
<DIV ID="GLHDR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<A HREF="#REPORT_ANNUAL-123115_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	believe the claims of this patent are valid and we have appealed the decision. Both European patents, if upheld as valid, are set to expire in 2025, absent any additional exclusivity granted based on regulatory review timelines.&#160; Fampyra also has 10 years of market exclusivity in the European Union that is set to expire in 2021.&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	We will vigorously defend our intellectual property rights.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Zanaflex
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Zanaflex Capsules and Zanaflex tablets are FDA-approved as short-acting drugs for the management of spasticity, a symptom of many central nervous system disorders, including MS and spinal cord injury. These products contain tizanidine hydrochloride, one of the two leading drugs used to treat spasticity.&#160;&#160;We launched Zanaflex Capsules in April 2005 as part of our strategy to build a commercial platform for the potential market launch of Ampyra.&#160;&#160;Combined net revenue of Zanaflex Capsules and Zanaflex tablets was $24.4 million for the year ended December 31, 2015 and $1.5 million for the year ended December 31, 2014.&#160;&#160;Net revenue includes the impact of a one-time increase in net revenue of $22.2 million in the quarter ended September 30, 2015, representing the cumulative impact of our conversion from the sell-through to the sell-in method of revenue recognition.&#160;&#160;Under the sell-in method of revenue recognition, revenue is recognized when the product is shipped to the distributor, whereas under the sell-through method, revenue is recognized when the product is prescribed to the patient.&#160;&#160;Going forward, Zanaflex revenue will be recognized under the sell-in method of revenue recognition.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	In 2012, Apotex commercially launched a generic version of tizanidine hydrochloride capsules, and we also launched our own authorized generic version, which is being marketed by an Allergan subsidiary as part of its Actavis business (originally Watson Pharma, Inc.).&#160;&#160;In March 2013, Mylan Pharmaceuticals commercially launched their own generic version of Zanaflex Capsules.&#160;&#160;The commercial launch of generic tizanidine hydrochloride capsules has caused a significant decline in net revenue from the sale of Zanaflex Capsules, and the launch of these generic versions and the potential launch of other generic versions is expected to cause the Company&#8217;s net revenue from Zanaflex Capsules to decline further in 2016 and beyond.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Qutenza
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Qutenza&#160;is a dermal patch containing 8% prescription strength capsaicin the effects of which can last up to three months and is approved by the FDA for the management of neuropathic pain associated with post-herpetic neuralgia, also known as post-shingles pain.&#160;&#160;We acquired commercialization rights to Qutenza in July 2013 from NeurogesX, Inc.&#160;&#160;These rights include the U.S., Canada, Latin America and certain other territories.&#160;&#160;Qutenza was approved by the FDA in 2010 and launched in April 2010 but NeurogesX discontinued active promotion of the product in March 2012.&#160;&#160;In January 2014, we re-launched Qutenza in the U.S. using our existing commercial organization, including our specialty neurology sales force as well as our medical and safety reporting infrastructure.&#160;&#160;&#160;Net revenue for Qutenza was $1.0 million for the year ended December 31, 2015 and $0.9 million for the year ended December 31, 2014.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Astellas Pharma Europe Ltd. has exclusive commercialization rights for Qutenza in the European Economic Area (EEA) including the 28 countries of the European Union, Iceland, Norway, and Liechtenstein as well as Switzerland, certain countries in Eastern Europe, the Middle East and Africa.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Research &amp; Development Programs
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	We have one of the leading pipelines in the industry of novel neurological therapies.&#160;&#160;We are currently developing a number of clinical and preclinical stage therapies.&#160;&#160;This pipeline addresses a range of disorders, including chronic post-stroke walking deficits (PSWD), Parkinson&#8217;s disease, epilepsy, heart failure, MS, and spinal cord injury.&#160;&#160;Our pipeline includes the programs described below.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	CVT-301, CVT-427 and ARCUS Technology
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	We acquired CVT-301 in October 2014 with our acquisition of Civitas.&#160;&#160;CVT-301 is a Phase 3-ready inhaled formulation of levodopa, or L-dopa, for the treatment of OFF periods in Parkinson&#8217;s disease.&#160;&#160;Parkinson&#8217;s
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV>
<DIV ID="PGBRK" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<DIV ID="FTR">
<DIV ID="GLFTR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>

<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	disease is a progressive neurodegenerative disorder resulting from the gradual loss of certain neurons in the brain responsible for producing dopamine.&#160;&#160;The disease is characterized by symptoms such as impaired ability to move, muscle stiffness and tremor.&#160;&#160;The standard of care for the treatment of Parkinson&#8217;s disease is oral levodopa (L-dopa), but there are significant challenges in creating a dosing regimen that consistently maintains therapeutic effects as Parkinson&#8217;s disease progresses.&#160;&#160;The re-emergence of symptoms is referred to as an OFF period, and despite optimized regimens with current therapeutic options and strategies, OFF periods remain one of the most challenging aspects of the disease.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	CVT-301 is based on the proprietary ARCUS technology platform that we acquired with Civitas.&#160;&#160;The ARCUS technology is a dry-powder pulmonary delivery system that we believe has potential applications in multiple disease areas.&#160;&#160;This platform allows delivery of significantly larger doses of medication than are possible with conventional dry powder formulations.&#160;&#160;This in turn provides the potential for pulmonary delivery of a much wider variety of pharmaceutical agents.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	In December 2014, we announced that the first patient has been enrolled in a Phase 3 study of CVT-301 for the treatment of OFF periods in Parkinson&#8217;s disease.&#160;&#160;&#160;We expect results from the efficacy trial in the fourth quarter of 2016, and pending timely recruitment for clinical trials, our goal to file a new drug application, or NDA, in the U.S. in the first quarter of 2017.&#160;&#160;We expect that the NDA will be filed under section 505(b)(2) of the Food Drug and Cosmetic Act, referencing data from the branded L-dopa product Sinemet&#174;.&#160;&#160;Based on Civitas&#8217;s interactions with the FDA, we believe a single Phase 3 efficacy study will be needed for filing an NDA, supported by existing Phase 2b data.&#160;&#160;A separate long-term safety study will also be required
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE">
	.
</FONT>
	We are projecting that, if approved, annual peak net revenue of CVT-301 in the U.S. alone could exceed $500 million.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	In June 2015, we presented data from a Phase 2b clinical trial of CVT-301 at the 19th International Congress of Parkinson's Disease and Movement Disorders (MDS).&#160;&#160;The data showed that patients experiencing an OFF period, treated with CVT-301, experienced significantly greater improvements in motor function than patients treated with an inhaled placebo; the difference in improvement was already apparent 10 minutes after dosing and&#160;was durable for at least an hour, the longest time point at which&#160;patients were measured.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	In addition to CVT-301, we are exploring opportunities for other proprietary products in which inhaled delivery using our ARCUS technology can provide a significant therapeutic benefit to patients.&#160;&#160;For example, we are currently developing CVT-427, an inhaled triptan (zolmitriptan) intended for acute treatment of migraine by using the ARCUS delivery system.&#160;&#160;Triptans are the class of drug most commonly prescribed for the acute treatment of&#160;migraine. Oral triptans, which account for the majority of all triptan doses, can be associated with slow onset of action and gastrointestinal challenges. The slow onset of action, usually 30&#160;minutes or longer, can result in poor response rates. Patients cite the need for rapid relief from migraine symptoms as their most desired medication attribute. Additionally, individuals with migraine may suffer from nausea and delayed gastric emptying which further impact the consistency and efficacy of the oral route of administration.&#160;&#160;Triptans delivered subcutaneously (injection) provide the most rapid onset of action, but are not convenient for patients.&#160;&#160;Many triptans are also available in a nasally-delivered formulation.&#160;&#160;However, based on available data, we believe that nasally-delivered triptans generally have an onset of action similar to orally administered triptans.&#160; In December 2015, we initiated and completed a Phase 1 clinical trial of CVT-427 for&#160;acute treatment&#160;of migraine.&#160;&#160;We expect to provide an update on this program by the end of the first quarter of 2016.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Pursuant to the merger agreement under which we acquired Civitas, upon consummation of the acquisition $39.375 million of the aggregate cash consideration was deposited into escrow to secure the indemnification obligations of Civitas and Civitas&#8217;s securityholder.&#160;&#160;The escrow fund was released to the former Civitas securityholders in accordance with the merger agreement in the fourth quarter of 2015.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Plumiaz
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	We are developing Plumiaz, a proprietary nasal spray formulation of diazepam, for the treatment of people with epilepsy currently on stable regimens of antiepileptic drugs (AEDs) who experience bouts of increased seizure activity, also known as seizure clusters or acute repetitive seizures.&#160;&#160;In 2013, we submitted a
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV>
<DIV ID="PGBRK" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<DIV ID="FTR">
<DIV ID="GLFTR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="PN" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS; WIDTH: 100%">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; WIDTH: 100%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
