<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: NORMAL">
	New Drug Application (NDA) filing for Plumiaz to the FDA.&#160;&#160;In May 2014, the FDA issued a Complete Response Letter, or CRL, for the Plumiaz NDA.&#160;&#160;In May 2015, we announced that we completed discussions with the FDA, and are advancing development of Plumiaz.&#160;&#160;Based on these discussions, we are conducting three clinical trials for Plumiaz:
</FONT>
</FONT>
</FONT>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE ALIGN="CENTER" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" ID="HANGINGINDENT" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="">
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT;">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36PT">
<DIV>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE" FACE="SYMBOL, SERIF">
	&#183;
</FONT>
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	The first trial is a long-term open-label study assessing safety and tolerability of Plumiaz over 52 weeks. This trial will enroll approximately 100 participants ages 12-65.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE ALIGN="CENTER" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" ID="HANGINGINDENT" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="">
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT;">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36PT">
<DIV>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE" FACE="SYMBOL, SERIF">
	&#183;
</FONT>
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	The second trial is assessing the bioavailability, safety and tolerability of Plumiaz compared to diazepam rectal gel (Diastat&#174;). This open-label, randomized, crossover trial will enroll approximately 120 people with refractory epilepsy ages 12-65 who experience seizure clusters.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE ALIGN="CENTER" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" ID="HANGINGINDENT" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="">
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT;">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36PT">
<DIV>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE" FACE="SYMBOL, SERIF">
	&#183;
</FONT>
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	The third trial is a pharmacokinetic dose proportionality study in healthy adults.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: NORMAL; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	All three trials have been initiated and are currently enrolling.&#160;&#160;We are planning to resubmit the NDA for Plumiaz in the first quarter of 2017.&#160;&#160;Based on FDA guidelines, the expected review period of the resubmitted NDA would be six months.&#160;&#160;We have obtained orphan drug designation, which would confer seven years of market exclusivity from the date of approval for diazepam containing drug products for the same indication.&#160;&#160;We licensed two patent families relating to the clinical formulation for diazepam nasal spray, including a granted U.S. patent that is set to expire in 2029.
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-STYLE: NORMAL; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
	We anticipate that our current infrastructure can support sales and marketing of this product if it receives FDA approval.&#160;&#160;If approved, we project peak annual U.S. net revenue of more than $200 million.
</FONT>
</FONT>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: NORMAL; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	We acquired the Plumiaz program in December 2012 in connection with our acquisition of Neuronex, Inc., a privately-held development stage pharmaceutical company.&#160;&#160;We completed the acquisition pursuant to a merger agreement with Neuronex and Moise A. Khayrallah, acting as the Stockholders&#8217; Representative on behalf of the former Neuronex equity holders.&#160;&#160;In July 2015, we entered into an amendment to the merger agreement with Mr. Khayrallah, as Stockholders&#8217; Representative.&#160;&#160;Pursuant to the amendment, the Stockholders&#8217; Representative, acting on behalf of the former Neuronex equity holders, agreed to certain modifications to our future contingent payment obligations regarding the development and potential commercialization of Plumiaz, described below.&#160;&#160;In consideration of those modifications, pursuant to the amendment we paid the former Neuronex equity holders $8.75 million in the three-month period ended September 30, 2015.
</FONT>
</FONT>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: NORMAL">
	Under
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: NORMAL; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	the
</FONT>
	merger agreement, the former equity holders of Neuronex will be entitled to receive payments from us, in addition to payments we have already made under the merger agreement, upon the achievement of specified regulatory, manufacturing-related, and sales milestones with respect to Plumiaz.&#160;&#160;Pursuant to the merger agreement as amended by the amendment, we are obligated to pay (i) up to $3 million in specified regulatory and manufacturing-related milestone payments, a reduction from up to $18 million in such payments that were
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: NORMAL; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	originally specified in the merger agreement, and (ii) up to $100 million upon the achievement of specified sales milestones, a reduction from up to $105 million in such payments that were originally specified in the merger agreement. Under the merger agreement, the former equity holders of Neuronex will also be entitled to receive tiered royalty-like earnout payments on worldwide net sales of Plumiaz, if any.&#160;&#160;The rates for these payments pursuant to the merger agreement originally ranged from the upper single digits to lower double digits, but were modified pursuant to the amendment and now range from the mid-single digits to mid double digits.&#160;&#160;These payments are payable on a country-by-country basis until the earlier to occur of ten years after the first commercial sale of a product in such country and the entry of generic competition in such country as defined in the Agreement.
</FONT>
</FONT>
</FONT>
</FONT>
</FONT>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: NORMAL; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	The patent and other intellectual property and other rights relating to Plumiaz are licensed from SK Biopharmaceuticals Co., Ltd. (SK).&#160;&#160;Pursuant to the SK license, which granted worldwide rights to Neuronex, except certain specified Asian countries, the Company&#8217;s subsidiary Neuronex is obligated to pay SK up to $8 million upon the achievement of specified development milestones with respect to Plumiaz (including a $1 million payment that was triggered in 2013 upon the FDA&#8217;s acceptance for review of the first NDA for Plumiaz),
</FONT>
</FONT>
</FONT>
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV>
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV>
<DIV ID="PGBRK" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<DIV ID="FTR">
<DIV ID="GLFTR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="PN" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS; WIDTH: 100%">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; WIDTH: 100%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	96
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; WIDTH: 100%">
<HR STYLE="COLOR: BLACK" NOSHADE SIZE="2">
</DIV>
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage101"></A>
<DIV ID="HDR">
<DIV ID="GLHDR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<A HREF="#REPORT_ANNUAL-123115_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV>
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV>
	and up to $3 million upon the achievement of specified sales milestones with respect to the diazepam nasal spray product.&#160;&#160;Also, Neuronex is obligated to pay SK a tiered, mid-single digit royalty on net sales of Plumiaz.
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Ampyra/Dalfampridine Development Programs
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	We believe there may be potential for dalfampridine to be applied to neurological conditions in addition to MS.&#160;&#160;In December 2014, we announced that the first patient has been enrolled in a Phase 3 clinical trial evaluating the use of dalfampridine administered twice daily (BID) to improve walking in people who are suffering from chronic post-stroke walking deficits (PSWD) after experiencing an ischemic stroke.&#160;&#160;As part of the trial design, we are planning to conduct an interim analysis of the trial data in the third quarter of 2016.&#160;&#160;This
</FONT>
	analysis, combined with the results from our development efforts on a once-daily formulation of dalfampridine (described below), will establish the next steps for the program.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	We have been exploring a once-daily (QD) formulation of dalfampridine for use in the post-stroke clinical program.&#160;&#160;Based on the results of an
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	in vitro
</FONT>
	alcohol dose dumping study and a subsequent fed-fasted study, we determined that the initial QD formulation that we had been developing with an external partner was not practical for further testing.&#160;&#160;We currently have three prototypes from three different partners based on
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	in vitro
</FONT>
	testing, which do not have the alcohol dose dumping issue we identified with the initial QD formulation.&#160;&#160;All three prototypes are currently in Phase 1 pharmacokinetic studies, and we expect to provide an update on these studies by the end of the first quarter of 2016.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Remyelinating Antibodies
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	rHIgM22 is the lead antibody in our remyelinating antibody program, and we are developing it as a potential therapeutic for MS. We believe a therapy that could repair myelin sheaths has the potential to restore neurological function to those affected by demyelinating conditions.&#160; In April 2013, we initiated a Phase 1 clinical trial of rHIgM22 to assess the safety and tolerability of rHIgM22 in patients with MS.&#160; The study also includes several exploratory clinical, imaging and biomarker measures.
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
	We announced top-line safety and tolerability results in February 2015. The trial, which followed participants for up to six months after receiving a single dose of rHIgM22, found no dose-limiting toxicities at any of the five dose levels studied.&#160; In April 2015, we presented
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;additional safety data from this trial at the 67
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	th
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE">
	American Academy of Neurology Annual Meeting.&#160;&#160;The additional data showed that rHIgM22 was well tolerated in each of the five doses, supporting additional clinical development.&#160;&#160;In October 2015, we presented pharmacokinetics from the trial in patients with stable MS, confirming that rHIgM22 penetrates the central nervous system.&#160;&#160;This data was presented at the 31
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	st
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Congress of the European Committee
</FONT>
	for Treatment and Research in Multiple Sclerosis (ECTRIMS) annual meeting.&#160;&#160;We are advancing clinical development of rHIgM22 for MS.&#160;
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE">
	We are currently enrolling
</FONT>
	a Phase 1 trial using one of two doses of rHIgM22 or placebo in people with MS who are experiencing an acute relapse.&#160;&#160;In addition to assessing safety and tolerability during an acute relapse, the study includes exploratory efficacy measures such as a timed walk, magnetization transfer ratio imaging of lesion myelination in the brain and various biomarkers.&#160;&#160;We expect to complete the&#160;trial in the first half of 2017.
</FONT>
</FONT>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Cimaglermin alfa
</FONT>
	/Neuregulins
</FONT>
</FONT>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: NORMAL; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Cimaglermin alfa is our lead product candidate for our neuregulin program.&#160;&#160;We have completed a cimaglermin Phase 1 clinical trial in heart failure patients.&#160;&#160;This was a dose-escalating trial designed to test the maximum tolerated single dose, with follow-up assessments at one, three, and six months.&#160;&#160;Data from this trial showed a dose-related improvement in ejection fraction in addition to safety findings.&#160;&#160;A dose-limiting toxicity was also identified in the highest planned dose cohort, specifically acute liver injury meeting Hy&#8217;s Law for drug induced hepatotoxicity, which resolved within several days.&#160;&#160;In March 2015, we presented new analyses of data from this trial at the American College of Cardiology (ACC) 64th Annual Scientific Session and Expo.&#160;&#160;These analyses found that cimaglermin produced a dose-dependent benefit at multiple time points for up to three months following a single infusion.
</FONT>
</FONT>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	In October 2013, we commenced a second clinical trial of cimaglermin.&#160;&#160;This Phase 1b single-infusion trial in people with heart failure is assessing tolerability of three dose levels of cimaglermin, which were tested in the first trial, and also includes assessment of drug-drug interactions and several exploratory measures of
</FONT>
<BR>
	&#160;
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<DIV ID="PGBRK" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<DIV ID="FTR">
<DIV ID="GLFTR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="PN" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS; WIDTH: 100%">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; WIDTH: 100%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	97
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; WIDTH: 100%">
<HR STYLE="COLOR: BLACK" NOSHADE SIZE="2">
</DIV>
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage102"></A>
<DIV ID="HDR">
<DIV ID="GLHDR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<A HREF="#REPORT_ANNUAL-123115_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: NORMAL; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	efficacy.&#160;&#160;In June 2015 we announced that we had stopped enrollment in this trial based on the occurrence of a case of hepatotoxicity (liver injury) meeting Hy&#8217;s Law criteria (elevated ALT, AST and bilirubin), based on blood test results.&#160;&#160;We also received a notification of clinical hold from the FDA following submission of this information, and the trial remains subject to this clinical hold.&#160;&#160;The abnormal blood tests resolved within several days, as was the case with the one Hy&#8217;s Law case reported in the previous Phase 1 study noted above.&#160;&#160;The 22 patients who were dosed in the trial will complete the pre-planned one year of follow up.&#160;&#160;Outside of the hepatoxicity case, the safety profile from this trial was consistent with our first Phase 1 trial, but efficacy data was inconclusive which we believe was in part due to the very small number of patients in the trial.&#160;&#160;We have ongoing analyses and non-clinical studies to investigate the biological basis for liver effects, and we will need to meet with the FDA to review these and other data from the cimaglermin studies and to request that the program be removed from clinical hold.
</FONT>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Chondroitinase Program
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	We are continuing research on the potential use of chondroitinases for the treatment of injuries to the brain and spinal cord, as well as other neurotraumatic indications.&#160;&#160;The chondroitinase program is in the research and translational development phase and has not yet entered formal preclinical development.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	NP-1998
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	NP-1998 is a Phase 3 ready, 20% prescription strength capsaicin topical solution that we have been assessing for the treatment of neuropathic pain.&#160;&#160;We acquired rights to NP-1998 from NeurogesX, Inc. in 2013 in connection with our purchase of Qutenza, an FDA-approved dermal patch containing 8% prescription strength capsaicin.&#160;&#160;We acquired development and commercialization rights in the United States, Canada, Latin America and certain other territories.&#160;&#160;Astellas Pharma Europe Ltd. has an option to develop NP-1998 in the European Economic Area (EEA) including the 28 countries of the European Union, Iceland, Norway, and Liechtenstein as well as Switzerland, certain countries in Eastern Europe, the Middle East and Africa. We believe this liquid formulation of the capsaicin-based therapy has key advantages over the Qutenza patch, and we believe NP-1998 has the potential to treat multiple neuropathies.&#160;&#160;However, we have no current plans to invest in further development of NP-1998 for neuropathic pain.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Outlook for 2016
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Financial Guidance for 2016
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	We are providing the following guidance with respect to our 2016 financial performance:
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;

	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE" FACE="SYMBOL, SERIF">
	&#183;
</FONT>
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	We expect 2016 net revenue from the sale of Ampyra to range from $475 million to $485 million.
</FONT>

<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
<DIV>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE" FACE="SYMBOL, SERIF">
	&#183;
</FONT>
</FONT>
</DIV>

<TD>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Research and development (R&amp;D) expenses in 2016 are expected to range from $165 million to $175 million, excluding share-based compensation charges and expenditures related to the potential acquisition of new products or other business development activities.&#160;&#160;The increase in research and development expenses in 2016 is primarily related to Phase 3 studies of CVT-301, Plumiaz and dalfampridine and continuing development costs for rHIgM22 and CVT-427, as well ongoing preclinical studies.
</FONT>
</DIV>

	Selling, general and administrative (SG&amp;A) expenses in 2016 are expected to range from $195 million to $205 million, excluding share-based compensation charges.&#160;&#160;&#160;We are setting a high priority on managing selling, general and administrative expenses in 2016.

	The range of SG&amp;A and R&amp;D expenditures for 2016 excludes potential expenses related to the acquisition of Biotie as we are unable to make a determination about the potential expenses for Biotie until the acquisition is completed.

	The range of SG&amp;A and R&amp;D expenditures for 2016 are non-GAAP financial measures because they exclude share-based compensation charges and certain non-cash expenses related to the Civitas acquisition.&#160;&#160;Non-
</FONT>

<DIV ID="PGBRK" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">

<A NAME="eolPage103"></A>
<DIV ID="HDR">
<DIV ID="GLHDR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<A HREF="#REPORT_ANNUAL-123115_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	GAAP financial measures are not an alternative for financial measures prepared in accordance with GAAP.&#160;&#160;However, we believe the presentation of these non-GAAP financial measures, when viewed in conjunction with actual GAAP results, provides investors with a more meaningful understanding of our projected operating performance because they exclude non-cash charges that are substantially dependent on changes in the market price of our common stock.&#160;&#160;We believe that non-GAAP financial measures that exclude share-based compensation charges and certain non-cash expenses related to the Civitas acquisition help indicate underlying trends in our business, and are important in comparing current results with prior period results and understanding expected operating performance.&#160;&#160;Also, our management uses non-GAAP financial measures that exclude share-based compensation charges and certain non-cash expenses related to the Civitas acquisition to establish budgets and operational goals, and to manage our business and to evaluate its performance.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Development Pipeline Goals
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Our planned goals and key initiatives with respect to our pipeline during 2016 and beyond are
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 12PT; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	as
</FONT>
	follows:
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE ALIGN="CENTER" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" ID="HANGINGINDENT" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="">
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT;">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
<DIV>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE" FACE="SYMBOL, SERIF">
	&#183;
</FONT>
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Continue progressing our Phase 3 efficacy and safety studies of CVT-301 for the treatment of OFF periods in Parkinson&#8217;s disease.&#160;&#160;We expect results from the efficacy trial in the fourth quarter of 2016, and pending timely recruitment for clinical trials, our goal is to file a new drug application, or NDA, in the U.S. by the first quarter of 2017.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE ALIGN="CENTER" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" ID="HANGINGINDENT" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="">
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT;">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
<DIV>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE" FACE="SYMBOL, SERIF">
	&#183;
</FONT>
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Continue progressing our Phase 3 clinical trial assessing the use of a twice-daily (BID) formulation of dalfampridine as a treatment for chronic post-stroke walking deficits (PSWD) after experiencing an ischemic stroke.&#160;&#160;As part of the trial design, we are planning to conduct an interim analysis of the trial data in the third quarter of 2016.&#160;&#160;This analysis, combined with the results from our development efforts on a once-daily (QD) formulation of dalfampridine, will establish the next steps for the program.&#160;&#160;We are working with different external partners to develop a once-daily (QD) formulation that could be included in future post-stroke studies.&#160;&#160;We currently have three prototypes from three different partners based on
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	in vitro
</FONT>
	testing, which do not have the alcohol dose dumping issue we identified with the initial QD formulation.&#160;&#160;All three prototypes are currently in Phase 1 pharmacokinetic studies, and we expect to provide an update on these studies by the end of the first quarter of 2016.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE ALIGN="CENTER" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" ID="HANGINGINDENT" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="">
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT;">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
<DIV>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE" FACE="SYMBOL, SERIF">
	&#183;
</FONT>
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	We are developing Plumiaz, a proprietary nasal spray formulation of diazepam, for the treatment of people with epilepsy who experience seizure clusters or&#160;acute repetitive seizures.&#160;&#160;In 2013, we submitted a New Drug Application (NDA) filing for Plumiaz to the FDA.&#160;&#160;In May 2014, the FDA issued a Complete Response Letter, or CRL, for the Plumiaz NDA.&#160;&#160;In May 2015, we announced that we completed discussions with the FDA, and are advancing the development of Plumiaz.&#160;&#160;Based on these discussions, we are conducting three clinical trials for Plumiaz, which have been initiated and are currently enrolling.&#160;&#160;We are planning to resubmit the NDA for Plumiaz in the first quarter of 2017.&#160;&#160;Based on FDA guidelines, the expected review period of the resubmitted NDA would be six months.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE ALIGN="CENTER" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" ID="HANGINGINDENT" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="">
<TR VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT;">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
<DIV>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE" FACE="SYMBOL, SERIF">
	&#183;
</FONT>
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	In June 2015 we announced that we had stopped enrollment in our second clinical trial of cimaglermin based on the occurrence of a case of hepatotoxicity (liver injury) meeting Hy&#8217;s Law criteria (elevated ALT, AST and bilirubin), based on blood test results.&#160;&#160;We also received a notification of clinical hold from the FDA following submission of this information, and the trial remains subject to the clinical hold.&#160;&#160;The 22 patients who were dosed in the trial will complete the pre-planned one year of follow up.&#160;&#160;Outside of the hepatoxicity case, the safety profile from this trial was consistent with our first Phase 1 trial, but efficacy data was inconclusive which we believe was in part due to the very small number of patients in the trial.&#160;&#160;We have ongoing analyses and non-clinical studies to investigate the biological basis for liver effects, and we will need to meet with the FDA to review these and other data from the cimaglermin studies and to request that the program be removed from clinical hold.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>

	Our Phase 1 clinical trial of rHIgM22 found no dose-limiting toxicities at any of, and was well tolerated in each of, the five dose levels studied.&#160;&#160;In October 2015, we presented pharmacokinetics from the trial in
</FONT>

<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	patients with stable MS, confirming that rHIgM22 penetrates the central nervous system.&#160;&#160;We are advancing clinical development of rHIgM22 for MS.&#160;&#160;
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE">
	We are currently enrolling
</FONT>
	a Phase 1 trial using one of two doses of rHIgM22 or placebo in people with MS who are experiencing an acute relapse.&#160;&#160;In addition to assessing safety and tolerability during an acute relapse, the study includes exploratory efficacy measures such as a timed walk, magnetization transfer ratio imaging of lesion myelination in the brain and various biomarkers.&#160;&#160;We expect to complete the trial in the first half of 2017.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">

<EFX_RESULTS_OF_OPERATIONS>
<A NAME="FIS_RESULTS_OF_OPERATIONS"></A>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Results of Operations
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Year Ended December 31, 2015 Compared to Year Ended December 31, 2014
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT STYLE="TEXT-DECORATION: UNDERLINE; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Net Revenue
</FONT>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Ampyra
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	We recognize product sales of Ampyra following receipt of product by our network of specialty pharmacy providers, Kaiser Permanente and ASD Specialty Healthcare, Inc.&#160;&#160;We recognized net revenue from the sale of Ampyra to these customers of $436.9&#160;million and $366.2&#160;million for the years ended December 31, 2015 and 2014, respectively.&#160;&#160;This net revenue reflected a 10.95% increase in our sale price for Ampyra effective January 1, 2015.&#160;&#160;The net revenue increase was comprised of net volume increases of $30.1 million and price increases and discount and allowance adjustments of $40.6 million. Net revenue from sales of Ampyra increased for the year ended December 31, 2015 compared to the year ended December 31, 2014 due to our price increase and greater demand we believe due to, in part, the success of certain marketing programs such as our First Step&#160;&#160;program.&#160;&#160;As with a number of specialty pharmaceuticals, first quarter sales for Ampyra typically have been lower than the preceding fourth quarter sales due to inventory build in the fourth quarter, and the temporary effects of people changing insurance plans and entering the Medicare donut hole at the beginning of the year. We expect a similar trend in 2016.&#160;&#160;Effective January 1, 2016, we increased our sale price to our customers by 10.95%.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Discounts and allowances which are included as an offset in net revenue consist of allowances for customer credits, including estimated chargebacks, rebates, discounts, and returns. Discounts and allowances are recorded following shipment of Ampyra tablets to our network of specialty pharmacy providers, Kaiser Permanente and ASD Specialty Healthcare, Inc.&#160;&#160;Adjustments are recorded for estimated chargebacks, rebates, and discounts.&#160;&#160;Discounts and allowances also consist of discounts provided to Medicare beneficiaries whose prescription drug costs cause them to be subject to the Medicare Part D coverage gap (i.e., the &#8220;donut hole&#8221;).&#160;&#160;Payment of coverage gap discounts is required under the Affordable Care Act, the health care reform legislation enacted in 2010.&#160;&#160;Discounts and allowances may increase as a percentage of sales as we enter into managed care contracts in the future.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Zanaflex
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Prior to the third quarter of 2015, the Company accounted for Zanaflex product shipments using a deferred revenue recognition model (sell-through). Under the deferred revenue recognition model, the Company did not recognize revenue upon product shipment.&#160;&#160;For product shipments, the Company invoiced the wholesaler, recorded deferred revenue at gross invoice sales price, and classified the cost basis of the product held by the wholesaler as a separate component of inventory. The Company recognized revenue when prescribed to the end-user, on a first-in first-out (FIFO) basis. The Company&#8217;s revenue to be recognized was based on the estimated prescription demand, based on pharmacy sales for its products using third-party information, including third-party market research data. The Company&#8217;s sales and revenue recognition reflected the Company&#8217;s estimate of actual product prescribed to the end-user.&#160;&#160;Beginning in the third quarter of 2015, the Company began recognizing sales for Zanaflex products when the product is shipped to its wholesale distributors (sell-in), as the Company believes there is now sufficient history to reasonably estimate expected returns. We also recognize product sales on the
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<DIV ID="PGBRK" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<DIV ID="FTR">
<DIV ID="GLFTR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="PN" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS; WIDTH: 100%">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; WIDTH: 100%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	100
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; WIDTH: 100%">
<HR STYLE="COLOR: BLACK" NOSHADE SIZE="2">
</DIV>
</DIV>

<DIV ID="HDR">
<DIV ID="GLHDR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<A HREF="#REPORT_ANNUAL-123115_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>

<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	transfer price of product sold for an authorized generic of Zanaflex Capsules.&#160;&#160;We recognized net revenue from the sale of Zanaflex products of $24.4 million for the year ended December 31, 2015, as compared to $1.5 million for the year ended December 31, 2014.&#160;&#160;The Company recognized a one-time increase in net revenue of $22.2 million for the year ended December 31, 2015, representing previously deferred product sales as of June 30, 2015, net of an allowance for estimated returns.&#160;&#160;Net product revenues also include $3.8 million which represents the sale of our Zanaflex Capsules authorized generic product to an Allergan plc subsidiary (originally Watson Pharma, Inc.), or Allergan, for the year ended December 31, 2015 as compared to $4.6 million for the year ended December 31, 2014.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Generic competition has caused a significant decline in net revenue of Zanaflex products and is expected to cause the Company&#8217;s net revenue from Zanaflex products to decline further in 2016 and beyond.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Discounts and allowances, which are included as an offset in net revenue, consist of allowances for customer credits, including estimated chargebacks, rebates, returns and discounts.&#160;&#160;Adjustments are recorded for estimated chargebacks, rebates, returns and discounts.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Qutenza
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	We recognize product sales of Qutenza following receipt of product by our specialty distributors. We recognized net revenue from the sale of Qutenza of $1.0 million and $0.9 million for the years ended December 31, 2015 and 2014, respectively.
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE">
	For the foreseeable future we do not expect that sales of this product will materially contribute to our revenues.
</FONT>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; TEXT-DECORATION: UNDERLINE; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	License Revenue
</FONT>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 45PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	We recognized $9.1 million in amortized license revenue for the years ended December 31, 2015 and 2014, respectively, related to the $110.0 million received from Biogen in 2009 as part of our collaboration agreement. We currently estimate the recognition period to be approximately 12 years from the date of the Collaboration Agreement.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT STYLE="TEXT-DECORATION: UNDERLINE; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Royalty Revenue
</FONT>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	We recognized $10.5 million and $10.0 million in royalty revenue for the years ended December 31, 2015 and 2014, respectively, related to ex-U.S. sales of Fampyra by Biogen.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	We recognized $7.0 million in royalty revenue for the year ended December 31, 2015 as compared to $9.1 million for the year ended December 31, 2014, related to the authorized generic sale of Zanaflex Capsules.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT STYLE="TEXT-DECORATION: UNDERLINE; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Cost of Sales
</FONT>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	We recorded cost of sales of $92.3 million for the year ended December 31, 2015 as compared to $80.0 million for the year ended December 31, 2014. Cost of sales for the year ended December 31, 2015 consisted primarily of $77.5 million in inventory costs related to recognized revenues.&#160;&#160;Cost of sales for the year ended December 31, 2015 also consisted of $10.0 million in royalty fees based on net product shipments, $0.6 million in amortization of intangible assets, and $0.4 million in period costs related to freight, stability testing, and packaging. Cost of sales also included $3.8 million which represents the cost of Zanaflex Capsules authorized generic product sold for the year ended December 31, 2015.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Cost of sales for the year ended December 31, 2014 consisted primarily of $65.4 million in inventory costs related to recognized revenues.&#160;&#160;Cost of sales for the year ended December 31, 2014 also consisted of $8.6 million in royalty fees based on net product shipments, $1.0 million in amortization of intangible assets, and $0.4 million in period costs related to freight, stability testing, and packaging. Cost of sales also included $4.6 million which represents the cost of Zanaflex Capsules authorized generic product sold for the year ended December 31, 2014.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>

<DIV ID="PGBRK" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">

<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	101
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; WIDTH: 100%">
<HR STYLE="COLOR: BLACK" NOSHADE SIZE="2">
</DIV>

<A NAME="eolPage106"></A>
<DIV ID="HDR">
<DIV ID="GLHDR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<A HREF="#REPORT_ANNUAL-123115_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT STYLE="TEXT-DECORATION: UNDERLINE; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Cost of License Revenue
</FONT>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	We recorded cost of license revenue of $0.6 million for the years ended December 31, 2015 and 2014, respectively.&#160;&#160;Cost of license revenue represents the recognition of a portion of the deferred $7.7 million paid to Alkermes in 2009 in connection with the $110.0 million received from Biogen as a result of our collaboration agreement.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT STYLE="TEXT-DECORATION: UNDERLINE; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Research and Development
</FONT>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Research and development expenses for the year ended December 31, 2015 were $149.2 million as compared to $73.5 million for the year ended December 31, 2014, an increase of $75.7 million, or 103.0%. The increase was primarily due to $49.3 million in research and development expenses related to CVT-301.&#160;&#160;The increase was also due to increases in expenses for various other research and development programs, including $6.3 million related to our life cycle management program for Ampyra, $10.8 million in expenses relating to work on Plumiaz, and $1.9 million in expenses related to cimaglermin alfa (previously referred to as GGF2).&#160;&#160;The increase was also due to an increase in overall research and development staff, compensation, and related expenses of $9.0 million to support our various research and development initiatives. The increases in research and development expenses were partially offset by decreases of $0.9 million related to AC105 and $0.5 million related to rHIgM22. R&amp;D expenses are expected to be significantly higher in 2016 based on continuation of Phase 3 clinical trials and advancement of other pipeline products.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT STYLE="TEXT-DECORATION: UNDERLINE; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Selling, General and Administrative
</FONT>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Sales and marketing expenses for the year ended December&#160;31, 2015 were $102.7&#160;million compared to $108.7&#160;million for the year ended December&#160;31, 2014, a decrease of approximately $6.0 million, or 5.5%.&#160;&#160;
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
	There was a decrease in overall marketing, selling, distribution, and market research expenses of $6.3 million partially offset by an increase in other selling expenses of $0.3 million.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	General and administrative expenses for the year ended December&#160;31, 2015 were $102.9 million compared to $93.1 million for the year ended December&#160;31, 2014, an increase of approximately $9.8&#160;million, or 10.5%. This increase was the result of an increase of $8.4 million for staff and compensation expenses and other expenses related to supporting the growth of the organization.&#160;&#160;&#160;The increase in general and administrative expenses was also attributable to an increase in legal and human resource expenses of $5.6 million and $0.7 million, respectively. The increases in general and administrative expenses for the year ended December&#160;31, 2015 were partially offset by a decrease in business development expenses of $3.8 million and post approval FDA commitment expenses for Zanaflex of $1.4 million.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT STYLE="TEXT-DECORATION: UNDERLINE; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Changes in Fair Value of Acquired Contingent Consideration
</FONT>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT ID="TAB1" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT">
</FONT>
	As a result of the original Civitas spin out of Alkermes, part of the consideration to Alkermes was a future royalty to be paid to Alkermes on&#160;&#160;Civitas products.&#160;&#160;Acorda acquired this contingent consideration as part of the Civitas acquisition.&#160;&#160;The fair value of that future royalty is assessed quarterly.&#160;&#160;We recorded expenses pertaining to changes in the fair-value of our acquired contingent consideration of $10.9 million for the year ended December 31, 2015 compared to $2.2 million for the year ended December 31, 2014, an increase of $8.7 million or 395%.&#160;&#160;The increase was due primarily to changes in fair value being measured over a full 12 month period in 2015 compared to changes in fair value being measured over approximately a 2 month period in 2014.&#160;&#160;The changes in the fair-value of the acquired contingent consideration were due to the re-calculation of discounted cash flows for the passage of time and updates to certain other estimated assumptions.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT STYLE="TEXT-DECORATION: UNDERLINE; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Other Expense
</FONT>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT ID="TAB1" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT">
</FONT>
	Other expense was $14.6 million for the year ended December&#160;31, 2015 compared to $8.4 million for the year ended December&#160;31, 2014, an increase of $6.2 million, or 73.8%. The increase was due to an increase in
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV>
<DIV ID="PGBRK" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<DIV ID="FTR">
<DIV ID="GLFTR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="PN" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS; WIDTH: 100%">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; WIDTH: 100%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	102
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; WIDTH: 100%">
<HR STYLE="COLOR: BLACK" NOSHADE SIZE="2">
</DIV>
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage107"></A>
<DIV ID="HDR">
<DIV ID="GLHDR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<A HREF="#REPORT_ANNUAL-123115_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV>
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	interest expense of $6.2 million, principally related to the cash and non-cash portions of interest expense for the convertible senior notes issued in June 2014 (the Notes). Interest expense related to the Notes was $14.6 million for the year ended December 31, 2015, of which the non-cash portion was $8.6 million.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT STYLE="TEXT-DECORATION: UNDERLINE; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Provision for Income Taxes
</FONT>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT ID="TAB1" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT">
</FONT>
	We recorded an $8.3 million provision for income taxes for the year ended December 31, 2015 as compared to a $10.3 million provision for income taxes for the year ended December 31, 2014. The provision for income taxes is based on federal, state and Puerto Rico income taxes. The effective income tax rates for the year ended December 31, 2015 and 2014 were 43% and 37%, respectively. The variances in the effective tax rates for the year ended December 31, 2015 and 2014 were due primarily to the non-deductible $8.8 million payment in July 2015 to the former equity holders of Neuronex and an increased benefit from the research and development tax credit. The Company&#8217;s effective tax rate for this year differed from the U.S. federal statutory rate of 35% primarily due to the impact of the research and development tax credit, the orphan drug tax credit, and state income taxes.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT ID="TAB1" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT">
</FONT>
	We continue to evaluate the realizability of the Company&#8217;s deferred tax assets and consider all available evidence, both positive and negative,&#160;&#160;to determine whether, based on the weight of that evidence, a valuation allowance will be required to reduce the deferred tax assets to the amount that is more likely than not to be realized in future periods.&#160;&#160;The Company maintains a valuation allowance on acquired state tax attributes expected to expire prior to their utilization.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Year Ended December&#160;31, 2014 Compared to Year Ended December&#160;31, 2013
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT STYLE="TEXT-DECORATION: UNDERLINE; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Net Revenue
</FONT>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Ampyra
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	We recognize product sales of Ampyra following receipt of product by our network of specialty pharmacy providers, Kaiser Permanente and ASD Specialty Healthcare, Inc.&#160;&#160;We recognized net revenue from the sale of Ampyra to these customers of $366.2&#160;million and $302.6 million for the years ended December 31, 2014 and 2013, respectively.&#160;&#160;This net revenue reflected a 10.75% increase in our sale price for Ampyra effective January 2, 2014.&#160;&#160;The net revenue increase was comprised of net volume increases of $31.7 million and price increases and discount and allowance adjustments of $31.9 million. Net revenue from sales of Ampyra increased for the year ended December 31, 2014 compared to the year ended December 31, 2013 due to our price increase and greater demand we believe due to, in part, the success of certain marketing programs such as our First Step program.&#160;&#160;As with a number of specialty pharmaceuticals, first quarter sales for Ampyra typically have been lower than the preceding fourth quarter sales due to inventory build in fourth quarter, and the temporary effects of people changing insurance plans and entering the Medicare donut hole at the beginning of the year.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Discounts and allowances which are included as an offset in net revenue consist of allowances for customer credits, including estimated chargebacks, rebates, discounts, and returns. Discounts and allowances are recorded following shipment of Ampyra tablets to our network of specialty pharmacy providers, Kaiser Permanente and ASD Specialty Healthcare, Inc.&#160;&#160;Adjustments are recorded for estimated chargebacks, rebates, and discounts.&#160;&#160;Discounts and allowances also consist of discounts provided to Medicare beneficiaries whose prescription drug costs cause them to be subject to the Medicare Part D coverage gap (i.e., the &#8220;donut hole&#8221;).&#160;&#160;Payment of coverage gap discounts is required under the Affordable Care Act, the health care reform legislation enacted in 2010.&#160;&#160;Discounts and allowances may increase as a percentage of sales as we enter into managed care contracts in the future.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Zanaflex
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, SERIF; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	During 2013 and 2014, the Company accounted for Zanaflex product shipments using a deferred revenue recognition model (sell-through). Under the deferred revenue recognition model, the Company did not recognize
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
